recipe_xml:
<recipe>
  <title>Baked Snapper with Harissa, New Potatoes, and Spring Onions</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['6 tablespoons olive oil'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tablespoons harissa paste'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'6 spring onions</ingredient>
    <ingredient>halved lengthwise</ingredient>
    <ingredient>or 8 scallions (left whole)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 pound new potatoes or small potatoes</ingredient>
    <ingredient>scrubbed</ingredient>
    <ingredient>thinly sliced'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Kosher salt</ingredient>
    <ingredient>freshly ground pepper'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 1/2 pound skin-on snapper fillets (3–4)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'lemon wedges (for serving)']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Place an oven rack in upper third of oven</step>
    <step>2. preheat to 425°F. Combine oil and harissa in a small bowl</step>
    <step>3. adjust flavor with more harissa if needed (spiciness and flavor vary from brand to brand).</step>
    <step>4. Toss onions and potatoes with half of harissa mixture in a large baking dish</step>
    <step>5. season with salt and pepper, then add 1/4 cup water. Roast, tossing once, until potatoes are fork-tender, 20–25 minutes. Meanwhile, score skin side of fillets about 1/4" deep</step>
    <step>6. season with salt and pepper. Rub remaining harissa mixture all over fish, getting into the score marks.</step>
    <step>7. Remove onions and potatoes from oven and heat broiler. Place fish skin side up on top of vegetables and broil until onions and potatoes are tender and fish is cooked through and starting to brown on top, 8–10 minutes.</step>
    <step>8. Serve fish and vegetables with lemon wedges for squeezing over.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Sweet Pretzels</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['Master Sweet Dough'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'All-purpose flour (for dusting)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 large egg white'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'6 tablespoons pearl sugar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Ingredient info: Pearl sugar</ingredient>
    <ingredient>a coarse sugar used for decorating baked goods</ingredient>
    <ingredient>is available at specialty foods stores and kingarthurflour.com.']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Line 2 large baking sheets with parchment. Punch down dough</step>
    <step>2. divide into 12 equal pieces.</step>
    <step>3. Working with 1 piece at a time and keeping remaining dough covered with a kitchen towel, roll dough on a lightly floured surface into a 17"- long rope. Form rope into a U shape. Lift top of left end</step>
    <step>4. fold over or under opposite side</step>
    <step>5. press together gently about two-thirds down from the top of right side. Lift right end up, fold over, and press in or tuck under, forming a pretzel shape. Repeat with remaining dough. Divide pretzels between sheets, spacing about 2" apart. Loosely cover with plastic wrap or a kitchen towel. Let dough rise in a warm, draft-free area until slightly puffed but not doubled in size, 30-45 minutes.</step>
    <step>6. Meanwhile, arrange racks in upper and lower thirds of oven</step>
    <step>7. preheat to 375°F. Beat egg white and 2 teaspoons warm water in a small bowl. Brush each pretzel all over with egg wash, then sprinkle each with 1/2 tablespoon pearl sugar.</step>
    <step>8. Bake for 10 minutes</step>
    <step>9. rotate baking sheets and continue baking until pretzels are golden, 6-8 minutes longer. Let pretzels cool on a wire rack.</step>
    <step>10. Serve warm or at room temperature.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Spinach Salad with Strawberry Vinaigrette</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['2 1/2 tablespoons strawberry vinegar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 tablespoons olive oil'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'5 ounces baby spinach (8 cups)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 pound strawberries</ingredient>
    <ingredient>cut lengthwise into thick slices (1 1/2 cups)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 cup pecan halves (3 1/2 ounces)</ingredient>
    <ingredient>toasted and cooled']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Whisk together vinegar, a rounded 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/8 teaspoon pepper in a small bowl, then add oil in a slow stream, whisking well. Put spinach, strawberries, and pecans in a large bowl and toss with just enough vinaigrette to lightly coat.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Baccalà Mantecato: A Savory Spread of Whipped Salt Cod</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['1 pound boneless baccalà (salt cod)</ingredient>
    <ingredient>soaked to remove salt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 medium russet potato (about 1/2 pound)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 plump garlic cloves</ingredient>
    <ingredient>finely minced'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 cup extra-virgin olive oil'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 cup half-and-half or light cream'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 cup poaching water from cooking the baccalà'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'freshly ground black pepper to taste'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'A heavy-duty electric mixer with the paddle attachment or a food processor']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. When the baccalà is sufficiently soaked, cut it into small pieces—6 inches or so—and put them in a saucepan or deep skillet with at least an inch of water to cover. Bring to a boil, set the cover ajar (rest it on a wooden spoon set on the rim of the pan), and cook at a steady bubbling boil for 20 minutes or more, until the cod is easy to flake but still has body and shape. Don't let it start to break apart. Lift it out of the cooking water, and let it drain and cool in a colander. Reserve a cup of the cooking water.</step>
    <step>2. Meanwhile, rinse the potato but leave it whole and unpeeled. Put it in a small pot covered with cold water. Bring to the boil, and cook steadily until you can easily pierce the potato with a knife blade.</step>
    <step>3. Let it cool, and peel it.</step>
    <step>4. Set up the electric mixer and flake all the fish into the bowl. Beat with the paddle at low speed to break the fish up more</step>
    <step>5. drop in the minced garlic, and beat at medium speed while you pour in half the olive oil very gradually in a thin stream, then add the potato and incorporate it</step>
    <step>6. continue beating at low speed as you gradually add the rest of the oil.</step>
    <step>7. Now raise the speed to high and whip the fish to lighten it.</step>
    <step>8. Reduce the speed to medium and incorporate the half-and- half gradually, then whip at high speed again. At this point the whipped cod should be smooth and fluffy, almost like mashed potatoes but with texture. If it is very dense, you can thin it with the cooking water (but be careful: too much water will make it too salty).</step>
    <step>9. Finally, season with pepper and beat it in to blend. If you use a food processor instead of a mixer, follow the same order of additions, and process as needed to form a light, smooth spread. Put the spread in containers and store sealed, in the refrigerator, for up to a week. You can also freeze baccalà mantecato</step>
    <step>10. the texture will not be as creamy, but it will have good flavor and makes a delicious pasta sauce.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Bean Thread Noodles with Pickled Vegetables</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['6 ounces wide bean thread noodles'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 small garlic clove</ingredient>
    <ingredient>finely grated'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 cup fish sauce (such as nam pla or nuoc nam)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 tablespoons fresh lime juice'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tablespoons unseasoned rice vinegar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 tablespoon sugar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 teaspoons finely grated peeled ginger'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 large daikon (Japanese white radish; about 1 pound)</ingredient>
    <ingredient>julienned'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 English hothouse cucumber</ingredient>
    <ingredient>thinly sliced'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 large carrots</ingredient>
    <ingredient>peeled</ingredient>
    <ingredient>julienned'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 cup vegetable oil'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 cup torn fresh cilantro</ingredient>
    <ingredient>divided'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3/4 cup unsalted</ingredient>
    <ingredient>dry-roasted peanuts</ingredient>
    <ingredient>coarsely chopped</ingredient>
    <ingredient>divided'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'ingredient info: Bean thread noodles and daikon can be found at Asian markets and some supermarkets.']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Place noodles in a large bowl and add boiling water to cover. Let noodles soak until tender but not mushy, 15-20 minutes</step>
    <step>2. drain. Rinse under cold water and drain well.</step>
    <step>3. Whisk garlic, fish sauce, lime juice, vinegar, sugar, ginger, and pepper in another large bowl. Add daikon, cucumber, and carrots</step>
    <step>4. toss to combine. Let sit 10 minutes.</step>
    <step>5. Add noodles, oil, half of cilantro, and half of peanuts to bowl</step>
    <step>6. toss to combine. Top salad with remaining cilantro and peanuts.</step>
    <step>7. DO AHEAD: Vegetables can be pickled 2 days ahead. Cover and chill.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Open-Face Lamb Burgers with Pistachio-Apricot Relish</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['2 1/2 pounds freshly ground lamb (preferably shoulder)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 1/2 teaspoons coarse kosher salt plus more for relish'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 cup diced pitted fresh apricots'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 cup finely chopped red onion'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 cup diced drained roasted red pepper from jar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tablespoons Sherry wine vinegar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 teaspoon curry powder'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 teaspoon sugar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 cup coarsely chopped unsalted natural pistachios'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 tablespoons chopped fresh mint'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Nonstick vegetable oil spray'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'6 (4-inch-diameter) slices (about 1/2 inch thick) sourdough bread']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Place ground lamb in large bowl</step>
    <step>2. sprinkle 2 1/2 teaspoons coarse salt evenly over. Gently mix in salt and shape meat into 6 patties, each about 3/4 inch thick. DO AHEAD Patties can be prepared 6 hours ahead. Arrange on baking sheet, cover, and refrigerate.</step>
    <step>3. Mix apricots and next 6 ingredients in medium bowl</step>
    <step>4. season with salt. Mix chopped pistachios and mint into relish.</step>
    <step>5. Spray grill rack with nonstick spray. Prepare barbecue (medium heat). Place burgers on grill. Place bread slices at edges to toast. Cook burgers to desired doneness and until slightly charred, about 5 minutes per side for mediumrare. Transfer bread to plates. Top each with burger. Spoon relish atop burgers.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Caesar Salad Roast Chicken</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['8 anchovies</ingredient>
    <ingredient>mashed to a paste'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'8 garlic cloves</ingredient>
    <ingredient>finely grated'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'6 tbsp mayonnaise</ingredient>
    <ingredient>divided'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 tbsp Dijon mustard</ingredient>
    <ingredient>plus more for serving'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tbsp extra-virgin olive oil</ingredient>
    <ingredient>divided'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1½ tsp freshly ground black pepper</ingredient>
    <ingredient>plus more'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 (3½–4-lb.) whole chicken or 4 chicken legs (thigh and drumstick; about 3 lb.)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Kosher salt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'8 medium shallots</ingredient>
    <ingredient>unpeeled</ingredient>
    <ingredient>halved lengthwise'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 lemons</ingredient>
    <ingredient>divided'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 oz Parmesan</ingredient>
    <ingredient>finely grated'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'4 oz country-style bread</ingredient>
    <ingredient>torn into (1½") pieces'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 romaine hearts</ingredient>
    <ingredient>leaves separated</ingredient>
    <ingredient>torn']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Place a rack in lower third of oven</step>
    <step>2. preheat to 450°F. Whisk anchovies, garlic, 3 Tbsp. mayonnaise, 1 Tbsp. mustard, 1 Tbsp. oil, and 1½ tsp. pepper in a small bowl. Set aside 1 Tbsp. anchovy mayo in another small bowl.</step>
    <step>3. Pat chicken dry</step>
    <step>4. season outside and inside all over with salt. Arrange breast side up in a cast-iron skillet and tuck wings underneath. Arrange shallots around (if using legs, nestle under and around)</step>
    <step>5. season with salt and pepper. Brush remaining anchovy mayo all over chicken, making sure to get it into the nooks and crannies, then brush shallots with any leftover anchovy mayo.</step>
    <step>6. Place chicken in oven so legs are facing toward the back (this is the hottest part of the oven and will help the legs cook before the breast dries out) and roast until some anchovy mayo and fat begin to drip onto shallots, about 15 minutes. Remove from oven and, using tongs, turn shallots to coat in drippings. Return skillet to oven and continue to roast chicken, stirring shallots once or twice, until golden brown and an instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part of breast registers 155°F, 45–55 minutes. If skin starts to get too dark on the top before chicken is done, tent area with foil, leaving the rest of the bird exposed. If using chicken legs, start checking at 40 minutes (a thermometer inserted right at the joint should register 160°F). Transfer chicken and shallots to a cutting board, leaving behind any juices and fat in skillet. If shallots need more time to soften and darken, roast a bit longer without chicken before proceeding. Reserve skillet.</step>
    <step>7. Reduce oven temperature to 400°F. Finely grate half of zest of 1 lemon into a large bowl</step>
    <step>8. cut lemon in half and squeeze in juice. Add reserved 1 Tbsp. anchovy mayo, remaining 3 Tbsp. mayo, and remaining 1 Tbsp. oil and whisk to combine, then stir in Parmesan. Season with salt and pepper. Set dressing aside.</step>
    <step>9. Add bread to reserved skillet with fat and turn to coat. Return skillet to oven and toast bread, tossing halfway through, until golden brown and crisp, 12–15 minutes. Transfer croutons to bowl with reserved dressing. Add romaine and gently toss until lettuce is well coated. Season salad with salt and pepper.</step>
    <step>10. Slice remaining lemon into wedges. Carve chicken and nestle back into skillet or transfer to a platter</step>
    <step>11. arrange shallots and lemon wedges around. Serve with salad and more mustard alongside.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Spicy Asian Chicken Soup</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['1 can (48 oz) nonfat chicken broth'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 cup soy sauce'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 tbsp brown sugar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 tsp Asian chili sauce (or 1/4 tsp red pepper flakes)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tbsp fresh lime juice'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1-inch piece fresh ginger</ingredient>
    <ingredient>peeled and cut in 8 slices'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3/4 lb boneless chicken breasts</ingredient>
    <ingredient>cut in thin 3-inch-long strips'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 tbsp cornstarch'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 cup sliced shiitake mushrooms (or white button mushrooms)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 cup snap peas (or snow peas)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 red bell pepper</ingredient>
    <ingredient>cored</ingredient>
    <ingredient>seeded and julienned'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 tsp lime zest'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tbsp chopped fresh cilantro']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Combine broth, soy sauce, sugar, chili sauce, lime juice, and ginger and boil 5 minutes. Meanwhile, toss chicken with cornstarch until completely coated. Add chicken and shiitakes to broth and simmer 15 minutes. Remove the pan from the heat and stir in snap peas, red pepper, zest, and cilantro. Let soup stand 2 to 3 minutes before serving.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Pear Pitcher Margaritas with Chile-Lime Rims</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['2 ripe Bosc or Bartlett pears'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/3 cup lime juice</ingredient>
    <ingredient>from about 3 limes'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2/3 cup tequila blanco'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tablespoons maple syrup'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Ice cubes</ingredient>
    <ingredient>for the blender and each glass'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'A small handful fresh cilantro</ingredient>
    <ingredient>leaves and tender stems'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Cardamom bitters</ingredient>
    <ingredient>optional'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 teaspoons chile powder'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 teaspoons ﬁne salt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 teaspoon lime zest</ingredient>
    <ingredient>from one of the above limes pre-juicing']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Peel pears and scoop out just the seeds</step>
    <step>2. the slightly harder parts of the ﬂesh will purée well. Chop into large chunks and place in the blender.</step>
    <step>3. Add lime juice, tequila, maple syrup, and 3/4 cup ice. Give everything a long whir until you have a smoothie-like consistency. Add the cilantro and pulse a few more times for green, herby ﬂecks.</step>
    <step>4. Now let the ﬂavors mingle in the blender while you prepare the rims.</step>
    <step>5. On a small plate, mix the chile powder, salt, and lime zest.</step>
    <step>6. Grab 4 glasses—about 6-ish ounces each. Run one of the spent lime wedges along each rim, then dip in the salt mixture, evenly coating the rim.</step>
    <step>7. Fill glasses halfway with ice, add 1–2 dashes of optional bitters, then pour 4 margaritas for 4 lucky people.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Chai-Spiced Almond Cookies</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['1/2 cup (1 stick) unsalted butter</ingredient>
    <ingredient>room temperature'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 1/3 cups powdered sugar</ingredient>
    <ingredient>divided'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 teaspoons vanilla extract'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 teaspoon almond extract'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3/4 teaspoon ground allspice'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3/4 teaspoon ground cardamom'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 teaspoon salt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 cup all purpose flour'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3/4 cup finely chopped toasted almonds']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Preheat oven to 350°F. Using electric mixer, beat butter, 1/3 cup sugar, both extracts, spices, and salt in medium bowl. Beat in flour, then stir in almonds.</step>
    <step>2. Using hands, roll dough into tablespoon-size balls. Place on large baking sheet, spacing apart. Bake until pale golden, about 25 minutes. Cool on sheet 5 minutes. Place remaining sugar in large bowl. Working in batches, gently coat hot cookies in sugar. Cool cookies on rack. Roll again in sugar and serve.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Clementine-Salted Turkey with Redeye Gravy</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['1/3 cup coarse kosher salt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'12 small clementines or tangerines (about); peel finely grated (3 tablespoons); fruit wrapped</ingredient>
    <ingredient>chilled'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 20-to 22-pound turkey</ingredient>
    <ingredient>rinsed</ingredient>
    <ingredient>patted dry; neck</ingredient>
    <ingredient>heart</ingredient>
    <ingredient>and gizzard reserved for Turkey Stock'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 large onions</ingredient>
    <ingredient>quartered'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 cup (1 stick) unsalted butter</ingredient>
    <ingredient>room temperature'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'6 cups (or more) low-salt chicken broth</ingredient>
    <ingredient>divided'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Turkey Stock'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'4 ounces country ham</ingredient>
    <ingredient>Serrano ham</ingredient>
    <ingredient>or thick-cut smoked bacon</ingredient>
    <ingredient>cut into 1/4-inch dice'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'6 tablespoons all purpose flour'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 cups freshly brewed coffee']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Rub salt and clementine peel together in small bowl. Sprinkle some seasoned salt in main and neck cavities of turkey. Place turkey in large roasting pan. Reserve 2 teaspoons clementine salt for roasting</step>
    <step>2. sprinkle remaining salt all over turkey. Cover pan with plastic wrap and refrigerate turkey overnight.</step>
    <step>3. Rinse turkey thoroughly inside and out</step>
    <step>4. pat dry. Rinse large roasting pan and wipe dry. Place rack in pan</step>
    <step>5. place turkey on rack and let stand uncovered at room temperature 1 hour.</step>
    <step>6. Set rack at lowest position in oven and preheat to 375°F. Tuck turkey wing tips under. Cut 6 clementines into quarters (reserve remaining clementines for another use). Stuff cut clementines and onions into main cavity. Tie legs together loosely. Spread butter all over turkey. Sprinkle with 1 teaspoon pepper and reserved 2 teaspoons clementine salt. Pour 3 cups chicken broth into pan.</step>
    <step>7. Roast turkey 45 minutes</step>
    <step>8. baste with pan juices. Reduce oven temperature to 350°F. Roast turkey until instant-read thermometer inserted into thickest part of thigh registers 165°F, basting occasionally with pan juices, adding more broth to maintain liquid level, and covering loosely with foil if browning too quickly, about 3 3/4 hours. Transfer turkey to platter</step>
    <step>9. tent with foil and let rest 30 to 45 minutes (internal temperature will rise 5 to 10 degrees).</step>
    <step>10. Pour juices from roasting pan into large measuring cup. Spoon off fat that rises to surface into 1-cup measuring cup. Add enough Turkey Stock to degreased pan juices to measure 5 cups. If necessary, add enough fat reserved from Turkey Stock to fat from pan juices to measure 1/2 cup.</step>
    <step>11. Heat 1/2 cup fat in heavy large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add ham and sauté 3 minutes. Whisk in flour</step>
    <step>12. cook 1 minute. Whisk in 5 cups broth mixture and coffee. Boil until gravy is reduced to 61/2 cups, about 15 minutes. Season to taste with pepper. Serve turkey with gravy.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Spicy Peanut Sauce</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['3 garlic cloves</ingredient>
    <ingredient>minced'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 teaspoon dried hot red pepper flakes</ingredient>
    <ingredient>or to taste'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 tablespoon vegetable oil'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 tablespoon tomato paste'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 tablespoons creamy peanut butter'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 tablespoons hoisin sauce'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 teaspoon sugar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3/4 cup water']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. In a small saucepan cook garlic and red pepper flakes in oil over moderate heat, stirring, until garlic is golden. Whisk in remaining ingredients and bring to a boil, whisking. Simmer sauce, whisking, until thickened, about 1 minute. Sauce may be made 3 days ahead and chilled, covered.</step>
    <step>2. Serve sauce warm or at room temperature.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Pecan-Streusel Coffee Cake</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['2/3 cup (packed) dark brown sugar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2/3 cup all purpose flour'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'6 tablespoons (3/4 stick) unsalted butter</ingredient>
    <ingredient>melted</ingredient>
    <ingredient>cooled slightly'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 cup pecans</ingredient>
    <ingredient>toasted</ingredient>
    <ingredient>coarsely chopped'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 cups all purpose flour'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'11/4 teaspoons baking soda'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 teaspoon ground nutmeg'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 teaspoon salt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 1/3 cups (packed) golden brown sugar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 cup (1 stick) unsalted butter</ingredient>
    <ingredient>room temperature'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 teaspoon vanilla extract'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 large eggs'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 cup whole-milk or reduced-fat'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'(2%) plain greek-style yogurt*']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Combine brown sugar, flour, and cinnamon in medium bowl. Add melted butter</step>
    <step>2. toss with fork to blend. Using fingertips, rub mixture together until small clumps form. Mix in pecans. DO AHEAD: Can be made 1 day ahead. Cover and chill.</step>
    <step>3. Position rack in center of oven and preheat to 350°F. Butter 9x9x2-inch metal baking pan. Combine flour, baking soda, nutmeg, and salt in medium bowl</step>
    <step>4. whisk to blend. Using electric mixer, beat brown sugar, butter, and vanilla in large bowl until well blended, about 2 minutes. Add eggs 1 at a time, beating well after each addition and scraping down sides of bowl occasionally. Add half of flour mixture</step>
    <step>5. beat just until blended. Add yogurt</step>
    <step>6. beat just until blended. Beat in remaining flour mixture just until blended.</step>
    <step>7. Spoon half of batter into prepared baking pan</step>
    <step>8. spread evenly. Sprinkle half of streusel evenly over batter. Spoon remaining batter in dollops over streusel, then spread evenly over with offset spatula. Sprinkle remaining streusel evenly over top.</step>
    <step>9. Bake cake until streusel topping is brown and tester inserted into center of cake comes out clean, about 45 minutes. Cool cake in pan on rack 30 minutes. Cut into squares and serve slightly warm or at room temperature.</step>
    <step>10. A thick yogurt</step>
    <step>11. sold at some supermarkets and at specialty foods stores and Greek markets. If unavailable, spoon regular yogurt into cheesecloth-lined strainer set over large bowl. Cover and refrigerate overnight to drain.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Grilled Mustard Broccoli</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['2 small heads of broccoli (about 1 1/2 pounds)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Kosher salt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 cup plain whole-milk greek yogurt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 tablespoon mustard oil or olive oil'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 tablespoon whole grain mustard'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'11/2 teaspoons Kashmiri chili powder or paprika'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 teaspoon chaat masala'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 teaspoon ground cumin'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 teaspoon ground turmeric'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Vegetable oil (for grill)']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Trim broccoli stems, then cut away from heads. Peel stems and slice lengthwise into 1/4"-thick planks. Break up heads into large florets. Cook florets and stems in a large pot of boiling salted water until bright green and crisp-tender, about 2 minutes. Drain, then transfer to a bowl of ice water to cool. Drain and pat dry with paper towels.</step>
    <step>2. Whisk yogurt, mustard oil, mustard, chili powder, chaat masala, cumin, and turmeric in a large bowl. Add broccoli and toss to coat</step>
    <step>3. season with salt.</step>
    <step>4. Prepare a grill for medium-high heat</step>
    <step>5. oil grate. Grill broccoli, turning occasionally, until charred in spots, 5–7 minutes. Transfer to a platter.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Chicken Pesto Wraps</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['1 cup cooked and cubed chicken'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'4 tablespoons pesto'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'4 whole wheat tortilla wraps'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 cup fresh baby spinach leaves'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 red bell pepper</ingredient>
    <ingredient>sliced into thin sticks'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 medium carrot</ingredient>
    <ingredient>sliced into thin sticks']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. In a small bowl toss chicken with pesto just to coat.</step>
    <step>2. Place 1 tortilla on a flat surface in front of you. Place 1/4 of the spinach onto the center of a tortilla and top with 1/4 of the peppers and carrots.</step>
    <step>3. Place 1/4 of the chicken on top of the vegetables.</step>
    <step>4. Wrap up into a burrito and repeat with remaining tortillas and ingredients.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Halibut with Zucchini Salsa Verde</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['10 ounces zucchini (about 2 medium)</ingredient>
    <ingredient>trimmed</ingredient>
    <ingredient>chopped'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 cup chopped fresh cilantro plus leaves for garnish'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/3 cup chopped white onion'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'5 tablespoons fresh lime juice'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 1/2 tablespoons chopped seeded jalapeño chiles'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 1/4 teaspoons finely grated lime peel'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 1/4 teaspoons coarse kosher salt</ingredient>
    <ingredient>divided'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Nonstick vegetable oil spray'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 1/4 teaspoons freshly ground black pepper'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 1/4 teaspoons ground coriander'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'6 6-ounce skinless halibut fillets or cod fillets']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Combine zucchini, chopped cilantro, and next 4 ingredients in blender. Add 1 1/4 teaspoons coarse salt. Puree until salsa is smooth. do ahead Can be made 2 hours ahead. Transfer to small bowl. Cover</step>
    <step>2. chill.</step>
    <step>3. Preheat broiler. Line broiler pan with foil</step>
    <step>4. coat foil with nonstick spray. Combine 1 1/4 teaspoons pepper, coriander, and remaining 1 teaspoon coarse salt in small bowl</step>
    <step>5. stir to blend. Pat fish dry. Sprinkle fish on all sides with seasoning mixture.</step>
    <step>6. Arrange fish on prepared pan. Broil until just opaque in center, 3 to 4 minutes per side, depending on thickness.</step>
    <step>7. Transfer fish to plates. Spoon some salsa over. Garnish with cilantro leaves. Serve with remaining salsa.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Mini Zucchini and Goat Cheese Tarts</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['1 refrigerated pie crust (half of 15-ounce package)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 1/2 pounds 1-inch-diameter zucchini</ingredient>
    <ingredient>cut into 1/16- to 1/8-inch-thick rounds'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 teaspoon salt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil plus additional for drizzling'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 teaspoons chopped fresh lemon thyme or regular thyme'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 ounces soft fresh goat cheese</ingredient>
    <ingredient>room temperature'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 cup freshly grated Parmesan cheese']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Line rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper. Place pie crust on floured work surface. Using 1 1/2- to 1 3/4-inch cookie cutter or biscuit cutter dipped in flour, cut out 24 rounds</step>
    <step>2. transfer to prepared sheet, spacing 1/2 inch apart. Place in freezer until dough is firm, about 30 minutes. DO AHEAD: Can be made 1 day ahead. Cover</step>
    <step>3. keep frozen.</step>
    <step>4. Toss zucchini with 1 teaspoon salt in medium bowl. Let stand 15 minutes. Drain and pat dry. Place zucchini in another medium bowl</step>
    <step>5. toss with 2 tablespoons olive oil and thyme. Sprinkle zucchini with pepper.</step>
    <step>6. Preheat oven to 400°F. Spread goat cheese generously over each frozen dough round. Fold 3 to 4 zucchini slices in half and place in concentric circle atop 1 dough round, creating flower-like pattern. Repeat with remaining zucchini and dough (reserve any remaining zucchini for another use). Sprinkle with Parmesan. Bake until crusts are light golden, about 20 minutes. Transfer to platter. Drizzle lightly with additional olive oil. Serve warm or at room temperature.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Shrimp Bisque</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['4 tablespoons (1/2 stick) unsalted butter</ingredient>
    <ingredient>divided'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 1/2 pound medium shrimp (about 45)</ingredient>
    <ingredient>peeled</ingredient>
    <ingredient>deveined</ingredient>
    <ingredient>shells reserved'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 bay leaves</ingredient>
    <ingredient>divided'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 carrots</ingredient>
    <ingredient>peeled</ingredient>
    <ingredient>chopped'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 celery stalks</ingredient>
    <ingredient>chopped'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 medium onion</ingredient>
    <ingredient>chopped'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 cup brandy'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 cup long-grain white rice'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tablespoons tomato paste'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 sprigs fresh flat-leaf parsley'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 sprigs fresh thyme'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 teaspoon (or more) cayenne pepper'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 cup heavy whipping cream'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 tablespoons fresh lemon juice'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 cup finely chopped fresh chives']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Melt 1 tablespoon butter in a large heavy pot over medium-high heat. Add shrimp shells and cook, stirring frequently, until they begin to brown, about 5 minutes. Add 1 bay leaf and 8 cups water. Simmer uncovered for 25 minutes. Set a fine-mesh strainer over a large bowl. Strain, discarding solids. DO AHEAD: Shrimp stock can be made 3 days ahead. Let cool slightly</step>
    <step>2. chill uncovered until cold, then cover and keep chilled.</step>
    <step>3. Melt 1 tablespoon butter in a large heavy pot over medium heat. Add shrimp and cook, stirring occasionally, until just opaque in center, 3-4 minutes. Transfer shrimp to a plate. Add remaining 2 tablespoons butter to same pot. Add carrots, celery, and onion and cook over medium heat, stirring frequently, until very soft, about 20 minutes.</step>
    <step>4. Remove pot from heat</step>
    <step>5. add brandy. Return pot to heat and stir until almost evaporated, 2-3 minutes. Add rice and tomato paste</step>
    <step>6. stir for 1 minute. Add shrimp stock, remaining bay leaf, parsley, thyme, and 1/4 teaspoon cayenne. Simmer uncovered until flavors meld and rice is soft, about 20 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Reserve 4 shrimp for garnish and stir remaining shrimp into bisque. Remove parsley, thyme, and bay leaf.</step>
    <step>7. Working in batches, purée bisque in a blender until smooth. Pour through a finemesh strainer set over a clean pot. Discard solids in strainer. Stir in cream and reheat bisque over medium heat. Add lemon juice. Season to taste with salt, pepper, and more cayenne, if desired.</step>
    <step>8. Mince reserved shrimp and mix with chives in a small bowl. Place 1 heaping tablespoon shrimp mixture in the center of large, shallow soup bowls. Ladle bisque around garnish and serve.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Lebkuchen Spice Mix (Lebkuchengewurz)</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['5 tablespoons/30g ground cinnamon'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 1/2 tablespoons ground cloves'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 teaspoon ground allspice'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 teaspoon ground cardamom'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 teaspoon ground ginger'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 teaspoon ground mace'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3/4 teaspoon ground aniseed']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Combine all the ingredients in a bowl and mix well to combine. Store in a glass jar with a tight-fitting lid. Kept in a dark, cool place, the mix will stay fresh for 1 year.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Crispy-Skinned Fish with Herb Sauce</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['2 oil-packed anchovy fillets (optional)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 small garlic clove</ingredient>
    <ingredient>thinly sliced'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 cup chopped tender herbs (such as parsley</ingredient>
    <ingredient>dill</ingredient>
    <ingredient>and/or basil)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 tbsp chopped pickles (capers</ingredient>
    <ingredient>cornichons</ingredient>
    <ingredient>or chile)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tbsp fresh lemon or lime juice or white wine vinegar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'6 tbsp (or more) extra-virgin olive oil</ingredient>
    <ingredient>divided'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Kosher salt</ingredient>
    <ingredient>freshly ground pepper'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'4 (5–6-oz) skin-on black bass</ingredient>
    <ingredient>striped bass</ingredient>
    <ingredient>snapper</ingredient>
    <ingredient>or salmon fillets'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Flaky sea salt']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Using the side of a chef’s knife, mash anchovies (if using) and garlic on a cutting board until a coarse paste forms. Mix in a medium bowl with herbs, pickles, lemon juice, and 5 Tbsp. oil. Season green sauce with kosher salt and pepper.</step>
    <step>2. Swirl remaining 1 Tbsp. oil in a large nonstick skillet to coat. Season fish generously on both sides with salt and lay, skin side down, in cold skillet. Place skillet over medium heat and let it gradually heat up until fat starts to cook out of fish, about 4 minutes. At this point you may press gently on fish so that the skin is flat against the pan. Continue to cook until skin is super-crisp and flesh is mostly opaque (you can increase or decrease heat slightly if needed, but don’t try to rush it), 8–12 minutes longer, depending on the thickness of the fish. Less fatty fish won’t release as much fat on their own, so you may need to add a splash more oil to the skillet if the skin isn’t getting crisp enough. Turn fish and cook just until opaque all the way through, about 1 minute.</step>
    <step>3. Spoon green sauce onto a platter and carefully set fish, skin side up, on top. Sprinkle with sea salt.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Dry Rub</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['2 teaspoons black peppercorns'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 teaspoons yellow mustard seeds'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 teaspoon cumin seeds'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 tablespoons paprika'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tablespoons brown sugar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 teaspoons kosher salt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 teaspoon celery seeds'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 teaspoon garlic powder'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Stir peppercorns, mustard seeds, and cumin seeds in a small skillet over medium heat until toasted, about 2 minutes. Let cool. Put into a spice grinder with next 6 ingredients and pulse until finely ground. DO AHEAD: Store in an airtight container for up to 3 months.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Milk Chocolate Pudding</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['2 tablespoons sugar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tablespoons cornstarch'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tablespoons unsweetened cocoa powder'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 1/2 cups whole milk'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 cup heavy cream'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'4 ounces fine-quality milk chocolate</ingredient>
    <ingredient>chopped'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'lightly sweetened whipped cream']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Whisk together sugar, cornstarch, cocoa powder, and a pinch of salt in a 2-quart heavy saucepan, then gradually whisk in milk and cream. Bring to a boil over moderately high heat, whisking constantly, then boil, whisking, 2 minutes. (Mixture will be thick.) Remove from heat. Whisk in chocolate and vanilla until smooth.</step>
    <step>2. Transfer to a bowl and chill pudding, its surface covered with wax paper (to prevent a skin from forming), until cold, at least 2 hours.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Kids' Chicken Katsu</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['1/2 cup ketchup'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 teaspoons strawberry jam'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 1/2 pounds chicken cutlets</ingredient>
    <ingredient>pounded 1/3 inch thick'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Kosher salt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3/4 cup all-purpose flour'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 large eggs</ingredient>
    <ingredient>beaten to blend'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 cups panko (Japanese breadcrumbs)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'8 tablespoons vegetable or grapeseed oil</ingredient>
    <ingredient>divided'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Cooked short-grain rice (for serving)']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Whisk ketchup, Worcestershire sauce, and strawberry jam in a small bowl to combine. Set sauce aside.</step>
    <step>2. Season chicken with salt. Place flour in a shallow bowl. Place eggs in another shallow bowl. Place panko in a third shallow bowl. Season each bowl with salt.</step>
    <step>3. Working one at a time, dredge chicken in flour, shaking off excess. Dip in egg, turning to coat and allowing excess to drip back into bowl, then coat with panko. Place on a large plate.</step>
    <step>4. Heat 6 Tbsp. oil in a large heavy skillet over medium-low until it sizzles when a pinch of flour is added. Cook half of chicken until just cooked through and golden brown, about 2 minutes per side. Transfer to paper towels to drain. Add another 2 Tbsp. oil to skillet and repeat with remaining chicken. Season with salt.</step>
    <step>5. Slice chicken crosswise into 1"-thick slices. Serve over rice with reserved sauce alongside for dipping.</step>
    <step>6. Chicken can be breaded 3 months ahead. Place between sheets of freezer paper or waxed paper in resealable plastic freezer bags</step>
    <step>7. freeze. Thaw before cooking.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Glazed Chocolate–Crème Fraîche Cookies</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['20 ounces bittersweet chocolate (at least 70% cacao)</ingredient>
    <ingredient>chopped</ingredient>
    <ingredient>divided'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 cup all-purpose flour'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 teaspoon kosher salt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 1/2 cups (packed) brown sugar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 cup (1 stick) unsalted butter</ingredient>
    <ingredient>room temperature'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'4 large eggs'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tablespoons crème fraîche or sour cream']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Place racks in lower and upper thirds of oven</step>
    <step>2. preheat to 350°F. Heat 8 ounces chocolate in a heatproof bowl set over a saucepan of simmering water (bowl should not touch water), stirring until chocolate is melted</step>
    <step>3. let cool slightly. Reserve saucepan for melting more chocolate for glaze.</step>
    <step>4. Whisk flour, baking powder, and salt in a small bowl</step>
    <step>5. set aside. Using an electric mixer on medium-high speed, beat brown sugar and butter until light and fluffy, about 4 minutes. Add eggs and crème fraîche and beat until just combined. Reduce speed to low and gradually mix in melted chocolate</step>
    <step>6. reserve chocolate bowl. Mix in dry ingredients just to combine</step>
    <step>7. fold in 8 ounces chopped chocolate. Cover and chill dough until firm, at least 30 minutes.</step>
    <step>8. Drop heaping tablespoonfuls of dough onto parchment-lined baking sheets, spacing 2" apart. Bake cookies, rotating sheets halfway through, until edges are set but centers are still slightly soft, 15–18 minutes. Let cookies cool on baking sheets 5 minutes. Transfer to wire racks and let cool.</step>
    <step>9. Melt remaining 4 ounces chocolate in reserved bowl set over reserved saucepan of simmering water. Let chocolate cool slightly, then dip or drizzle cookies with chocolate as desired. Let sit until chocolate is set, 15–20 minutes.</step>
    <step>10. DO AHEAD: Cookies can be made 2 days ahead</step>
    <step>11. store airtight at room temperature.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Grilled Corn with Herbs</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['8 ears of corn in the husk'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 cup chopped mixed fresh herbs such as chives</ingredient>
    <ingredient>parsley</ingredient>
    <ingredient>basil</ingredient>
    <ingredient>sage</ingredient>
    <ingredient>and tarragon'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'6 tablespoons lime butter sauce']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Prepare grill for cooking over medium-hot charcoal (moderate heat for gas).</step>
    <step>2. Grill corn (in husks) on lightly oiled grill rack, turning, covered, until kernels are tender, 20 to 30 minutes. Remove corn from grill and let stand until cool enough to handle but still warm, about 10 minutes.</step>
    <step>3. Discard husks and stem ends from corn. Cut kernels off cobs with a large knife and toss with herbs and lime butter sauce.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Spinach Shakshuka</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil</ingredient>
    <ingredient>plus more for drizzling'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 large yellow onion</ingredient>
    <ingredient>finely chopped'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 small jalapeño</ingredient>
    <ingredient>seeded and finely chopped'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'4 garlic cloves</ingredient>
    <ingredient>finely chopped'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 teaspoon ground coriander'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 teaspoon kosher salt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'10 ounces (280 g) baby spinach'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 teaspoons fresh lemon juice'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'4–6 eggs'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Freshly ground black pepper'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Feta cheese and roughly chopped fresh cilantro</ingredient>
    <ingredient>for sprinkling']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Heat the olive oil in a large pan set over medium heat. Add the onion and jalapeño and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, 6 to 8 minutes. Add the garlic, coriander, cinnamon, and salt, and cook, stirring, until fragrant, 1 to 2 minutes​.</step>
    <step>2. Add the spinach and lemon juice to the pan, turn the heat to low, cover, and cook, tossing occasionally with tongs, until the spinach is very soft, 7 to 10 minutes. (If the spinach does not fit all at once in the pan, add a little at a time, adding more as the spinach in the pan wilts.) Uncover and evenly spread the mixture across the bottom of the pan. Use the back of the spoon to make four to six shallow indentations​ in the surface of the greens mixture to hold the eggs while they cook.</step>
    <step>3. Break the eggs into small cups and gently slide them into the indentations. Raise the heat to medium, cover the pan , and cook until the whites are set but the yolks are still a bit runny, 4 to 5 minutes. Remove the pan​ from the heat. Drizzle a little more olive oil on top and sprinkle with pepper, feta, and cilantro. Serve hot, directly from the pan.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Brassicas Bowl</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['4 large eggs'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 bunch broccolini</ingredient>
    <ingredient>trimmed'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'5 tablespoons olive oil</ingredient>
    <ingredient>divided'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Kosher salt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 small shallot</ingredient>
    <ingredient>finely chopped'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tablespoons apple cider vinegar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 tablespoon whole grain mustard'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 bunch curly kale</ingredient>
    <ingredient>ribs and stems removed</ingredient>
    <ingredient>leaves torn into 2-inch pieces (about 8 cups)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'8 ounces brussels sprouts</ingredient>
    <ingredient>trimmed</ingredient>
    <ingredient>thinly sliced lengthwise'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Freshly ground black pepper'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 cup unsalted</ingredient>
    <ingredient>roasted sunflower seeds</ingredient>
    <ingredient>divided'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 cup hummus'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 avocado</ingredient>
    <ingredient>quartered lengthwise'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tablespoons finely chopped chives'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 tablespoon toasted sesame seeds'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Crushed red pepper flakes (for serving)']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Cook eggs in a large saucepan of boiling water for 7 minutes (whites will be set and yolks still slightly soft). Drain</step>
    <step>2. transfer to a bowl of ice water and let sit until cool. Drain</step>
    <step>3. peel eggs and cut in half lengthwise. Set aside.</step>
    <step>4. Preheat oven to 500°F. Toss broccolini with 1 Tbsp. oil on a rimmed baking sheet and season with salt. Roast, turning occasionally, until crisp-tender and charred in spots, 8–10 minutes. Let cool, then coarsely chop.</step>
    <step>5. Whisk shallot, vinegar, mustard, and remaining 4 Tbsp. oil in a large bowl until emulsified</step>
    <step>6. season with salt. Add kale and brussels sprouts and toss to coat</step>
    <step>7. season with salt and pepper. Massage kale until slightly softened, about 5 minutes. Add roasted broccolini and 2 Tbsp. sunflower seeds</step>
    <step>8. toss again.</step>
    <step>9. Swipe some hummus along the inside of each bowl with a spoon. Divide salad among bowls and add an avocado wedge and 2 reserved egg halves to each. Top with chives, sesame seeds, and remaining sunflower seeds</step>
    <step>10. sprinkle with red pepper flakes.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Chicken and Mango Salad with Ginger-Orange Dressing</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['1/2 cup plus 1 tablespoon vegetable oil'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 cup thawed frozen orange juice concentrate'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tablespoons unseasoned rice vinegar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tablespoons finely chopped crystallized ginger'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 1/4 pounds skinless boneless chicken breast halves (about 3)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 large bunches of watercress</ingredient>
    <ingredient>trimmed'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 large mango</ingredient>
    <ingredient>peeled</ingredient>
    <ingredient>pitted</ingredient>
    <ingredient>cut into 1/2-inch-thick slices'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 small red onion</ingredient>
    <ingredient>sliced paper-thin']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Whisk 1/2 cup oil and next 3 ingredients in small bowl to blend. Season dressing to taste with salt and pepper.</step>
    <step>2. Heat remaining 1 tablespoon oil in heavy large skillet over medium-low heat. Sprinkle chicken with salt and pepper</step>
    <step>3. add to skillet. Cover and sauté until cooked through, about 6 minutes per side. Transfer to cutting board. Cut crosswise into slices</step>
    <step>4. cool 5 minutes.</step>
    <step>5. Mound watercress on plates</step>
    <step>6. top with chicken, mango, and red onion. Drizzle with dressing and serve.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>All-Day Slow-Cooker Cassoulet</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['1 pound dried large white beans</ingredient>
    <ingredient>such as cannellini or baby limas'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 duck (about 4 pounds)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 pound boneless leg of lamb</ingredient>
    <ingredient>cut into 2-inch cubes'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 teaspoons kosher salt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 teaspoon coarsely ground black pepper'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'8 ounces garlic sausage</ingredient>
    <ingredient>cut into 2-inch lengths'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'8 ounces smoked sausage</ingredient>
    <ingredient>such as andouille</ingredient>
    <ingredient>cut into 2-inch lengths'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 large onion</ingredient>
    <ingredient>diced'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 large celery ribs</ingredient>
    <ingredient>cut into 1/4-inch-thick slices'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'4 cloves garlic</ingredient>
    <ingredient>minced'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 teaspoon dried Italian seasoning'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Pinch of ground cloves'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 cup dry white wine'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'4 cups beef or chicken broth</ingredient>
    <ingredient>or a mixture'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 can (about 15 ounces) diced tomatoes</ingredient>
    <ingredient>drained'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2/3 cup dried breadcrumbs'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 cup coarsely chopped fresh Italian (flat-leaf) parsley'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'5–6 quart slow cooker']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Put the beans in a medium bowl, cover with about 3 inches of water, and soak overnight. Or put the beans in a saucepan, cover with water, and bring to a boil for 3 minutes. Remove from the heat and soak for 1 hour. Then drain.</step>
    <step>2. Meanwhile, cut the duck into 8 pieces: 2 breast halves, 2 drumsticks, 2 thighs, and 2 wings. Trim off all visible fat and excess skin and set the fat and skin aside. Season the duck pieces and lamb with the salt and pepper and set aside.</step>
    <step>3. Cook the duck fat and skin in a large heavy skillet over medium heat until between 1/4 and 1/3 cup fat is in the pan, about 4 minutes. Remove the solid pieces of fat and skin and discard. Brown the duck in the hot fat on both sides, about 4 minutes per side, and set aside. Brown the lamb, about 4 minutes per side, and set aside. Brown the sausage pieces on all sides, about 3 minutes per side, and set aside.</step>
    <step>4. Add the onion and celery to the skillet and sauté until lightly browned, about 4 minutes. Add the garlic, nutmeg, Italian seasoning, and cloves and sauté until aromatic, about 1 minute. Add the wine and bring to a boil. Add the beef broth and tomatoes, return to a boil, and remove from the heat.</step>
    <step>5. Layer the beans and meats, in alternating layers (4 of beans, 3 of meat), starting and ending with the beans. Pour the liquid over all, cover the cooker, and cook until the beans are tender, 8 to 10 hours on low.</step>
    <step>6. Preheat an oven to 350°F. Mix the breadcrumbs and parsley and scatter over the top of the cassoulet. Transfer the crock with the cassoulet to the oven and bake until the top is browned and bubbling, about 30 minutes. Serve immediately.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Eggplant and Walnut Phyllo Pie</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['3 (1-pound) eggplants</ingredient>
    <ingredient>peeled and cut into 1/2-inch-thick rounds'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'About 1 1/2 cups olive oil</ingredient>
    <ingredient>divided'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 medium leeks (white and pale green parts only)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 cups coarsely grated _gravié_ra or sharp white Cheddar (5 oz)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3/4 cup coarsely grated Kefalotyri or Pecorino Romano (2 1/2 oz)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 1/2 cups walnuts (5 1/2 ounces)</ingredient>
    <ingredient>chopped'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 1/2 teaspoons ground cumin'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'20 (12- by 7-inch) phyllo sheets</ingredient>
    <ingredient>thawed if frozen']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Sprinkle eggplant with 1 1/2 teaspoons salt and drain in a colander 30 minutes</step>
    <step>2. pat dry.</step>
    <step>3. Heat 3 tablespoons oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat until hot, then fry eggplant in batches, adding about 3 tablespoons oil per batch and turning once, until tender and golden brown, 5 to 7 minutes total per batch. Drain on paper towels and cool to room temperature. Wipe skillet clean.</step>
    <step>4. Preheat oven to 375°F with rack in middle.</step>
    <step>5. Halve leeks lengthwise and thinly slice. Wash and drain.</step>
    <step>6. Cook leeks in 2 tablespoons oil in skillet over medium heat until golden, 7 to 9 minutes. Transfer to a bowl.</step>
    <step>7. Chop eggplant</step>
    <step>8. add to leeks with cheeses, nuts, cumin, and salt and pepper to taste.</step>
    <step>9. Trim phyllo sheets into 9-inch squares. Cover stack of phyllo with plastic wrap and a damp kitchen towel. Layer 10 sheets in a 9-inch square baking dish, lightly brushing each sheet with oil. Spread filling on top, then cover with remaining phyllo, brushing each sheet with oil.</step>
    <step>10. Cut several slits in phyllo (to vent) and bake until puffed and golden brown, 45 to 50 minutes. Let stand 10 minutes.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Brothy Heirloom Beans With Cream</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['2 cups mixed dried heirloom beans</ingredient>
    <ingredient>soaked overnight'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 quarts chicken stock or low-sodium chicken broth'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'4 sprigs thyme</ingredient>
    <ingredient>plus leaves for serving'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Kosher salt</ingredient>
    <ingredient>freshly ground pepper'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 cup heavy cream'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Flaky sea salt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Olive oil (for serving)']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Bring beans, stock, and thyme sprigs to a gentle simmer in a medium pot over medium-high. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer, partially covered, skimming any foam from surface, until beans are tender, 1–1 1/2 hours, depending on types. Discard thyme. Season with kosher salt and pepper, remove from heat, and let sit 30 minutes.</step>
    <step>2. Return to a simmer</step>
    <step>3. stir in cream. Season with more kosher salt and pepper if needed. Serve topped with thyme leaves and sea salt and drizzled with oil.</step>
    <step>4. Beans can be cooked 3 days ahead. Let cool</step>
    <step>5. cover and chill.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Toffee Squares</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['1 cup (2 sticks) unsalted butter</ingredient>
    <ingredient>at room temperature'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 cup firmly packed light brown sugar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 large egg yolk'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 teaspoon vanilla extract'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 teaspoon salt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 cups all-purpose flour'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'7 to 8 ounces milk chocolate</ingredient>
    <ingredient>broken into pieces</ingredient>
    <ingredient>or 1 1/2 cups milk chocolate chips'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 cup chopped almonds</ingredient>
    <ingredient>toasted']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Preheat the oven to 350°F. Line a 9-by-13-inch baking pan with parchment.</step>
    <step>2. Prepare the crust. In a large bowl, with an electric mixer, beat together the butter and sugar on medium speed until light, about 2 minutes. Beat in the egg yolk, vanilla, and salt. On low speed, gradually beat in the flour just until mixed. The dough will be stiff. Pat the dough evenly over the bottom of the baking pan.</step>
    <step>3. Bake in the center of the oven until pale gold on top, about 20 minutes.</step>
    <step>4. Remove the pan from the oven and scatter the chocolate pieces evenly over the crust. Return the pan to the oven for 1 minute. Remove the pan again and, using a knife, spread the chocolate evenly over the crust. Sprinkle evenly with the almonds.</step>
    <step>5. Let cool completely in the pan on a wire rack. Using a sharp knife, cut into small squares, then carefully remove from the pan with a small offset spatula or an icing spatula.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Kale Salad with Persimmons, Feta, and Crisp Prosciutto</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['3 ounces thinly sliced prosciutto'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/3 cup pecans (1 1/2 ounces)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 cup fresh lime juice (from about 2 limes)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 tablespoon Dijon mustard'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 tablespoon finely chopped shallot'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 teaspoon honey'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 small garlic clove</ingredient>
    <ingredient>finely grated'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Kosher salt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Freshly ground black pepper'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 cup extra-virgin olive oil'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 1/2 pounds Tuscan kale (about 2 large bunches)</ingredient>
    <ingredient>stemmed</ingredient>
    <ingredient>leaves thinly sliced'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 Fuyu persimmons</ingredient>
    <ingredient>peeled</ingredient>
    <ingredient>halved lengthwise</ingredient>
    <ingredient>thinly sliced'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 ounces firm</ingredient>
    <ingredient>creamy feta cheese</ingredient>
    <ingredient>such as Bulgarian</ingredient>
    <ingredient>crumbled (about 3/4 cup)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 cup loosely packed mint leaves</ingredient>
    <ingredient>thinly sliced</ingredient>
    <ingredient>plus more for serving']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Heat oven to 350°F. Lay out prosciutto slices on a rimmed baking sheet. Bake until almost crisp, 16–18 minutes. Transfer to wire rack and let cool completely on baking sheet (prosciutto will continue to crisp as it cools). Crumble and set aside.</step>
    <step>2. Meanwhile, spread pecans on a rimmed baking sheet and toast in oven, tossing once or twice, until fragrant, 8–10 minutes. Let cool, then coarsely chop. Set aside.</step>
    <step>3. Whisk lime juice, mustard, shallot, honey, garlic, 1 tsp. salt, and 1/4 tsp. pepper in a medium bowl, then whisk in oil in a slow, steady stream. Set aside.</step>
    <step>4. In a large mixing bowl, combine kale with about 3/4 of the dressing and use your hands to massage dressing into kale. Add more dressing as needed (you may not need all of it). Reserve any leftover dressing for another use.</step>
    <step>5. Add half of the persimmons, feta, mint, and prosciutto, toss together to combine, and season with salt and pepper to taste. Transfer to a serving bowl, and top with pecans and remaining persimmons, feta, mint, and prosciutto.</step>
    <step>6. Dressing can be prepared 3 days ahead</step>
    <step>7. cover and chill. Nuts can be toasted and chopped 1 day ahead</step>
    <step>8. cover and keep at room temperature. Kale can be sliced 1 day ahead</step>
    <step>9. place in an airtight container and chill. Salad can be tossed together 30 minutes ahead</step>
    <step>10. keep at room temperature.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Aged Rib Eye with Onion Purée</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['6 tablespoons unsalted butter</ingredient>
    <ingredient>divided'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 medium Vidalia or Maui onions (about 1 1/4 pounds total)</ingredient>
    <ingredient>very thinly sliced on a mandoline (about 3 packed cups)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 cup low-salt chicken stock'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 tablespoon buttermilk'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Kosher salt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 tablespoon vegetable oil'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 28-ounces dry-aged rib-eye steak (about 2" thick)</ingredient>
    <ingredient>standing at room temperature for 1 hour'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Coarse sea salt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Assorted soft herb sprigs (such as tarragon</ingredient>
    <ingredient>flat-leaf parsley</ingredient>
    <ingredient>and chervil)']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Heat 2 tablespoons butter in a 12" heavy skillet over medium-low heat. Add onions and cook, stirring constantly, until translucent (do not brown), 10-12 minutes. Add stock and 3/4 cup water. Bring to a simmer, reduce heat to low, cover, and continue to simmer until onions are falling apart, about 20 minutes. Uncover and stir until onions are almost dry (do not brown), about 5 minutes. Transfer onions to a blender. Add buttermilk and 1 tablespoon water. Purée until smooth. Season with kosher salt.</step>
    <step>2. Preheat oven to 350°F. Arrange a wire rack inside a rimmed baking sheet. Melt 2 tablespoons butter with oil in a large cast-iron skillet or large heavy skillet over medium-high heat. Season steak generously with kosher salt. Cook until a deep brown crust forms, 3-4 minutes per side and 1-2 minutes on edges. Place on prepared rack. Roast until a thermometer inserted into steak registers 115°F, about 40 minutes. (Steak will carry over to medium-rare.) Let rest for 30 minutes.</step>
    <step>3. Melt remaining 2 tablespoons butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat</step>
    <step>4. cook until butter browns, about 2 minutes. Add steak and cook for 30 seconds per side, allowing steak to absorb butter. Cut steak into 4 slices. Place 1 steak slice on each plate and sprinkle with sea salt. Spoon warm onion purée alongside. Scatter herbs over purée.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Chocolate-Almond Cupcakes with Fluffy Coconut Frosting</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['3/4 cup blanched almonds (or rounded 1/2 cup blanched slivered almonds)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 1/2 cups sugar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'6 cups sweetened shredded coconut (from two 14-ounce bags)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 1/4 cups all-purpose flour'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 cup unsweetened cocoa powder'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 tablespoon baking powder'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 teaspoon baking soda'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 teaspoon salt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 ounces unsweetened chocolate'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 cup (2 sticks) unsalted butter</ingredient>
    <ingredient>room temperature'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'4 large eggs</ingredient>
    <ingredient>room temperature'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 (13 1/2-ounce) can unsweetened coconut milk</ingredient>
    <ingredient>stirred'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Seven Minute Frosting'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Jordan almonds (optional)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 nonstick muffin pans</ingredient>
    <ingredient>each with 6 large (1-cup) cups']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Preheat oven to 350°F. Butter muffin cups.</step>
    <step>2. In food processor, process almonds and 1/2 cup sugar until finely ground. Add 2 loosely packed cups shredded coconut and pulse twice to chop slightly. Transfer mixture to medium bowl and whisk in flour, cocoa, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.</step>
    <step>3. In metal bowl set over pan of barely simmering water, melt chocolate, stirring until smooth. Remove from heat and set aside.</step>
    <step>4. Using electric mixer, beat butter and remaining 1 cup sugar at high speed until fluffy, about 5 minutes. Beat in eggs 1 at a time, beating well after each addition. Add melted chocolate and beat at moderate speed until incorporated. Add 1/2 of flour mixture and mix at low speed until nearly smooth. Add coconut milk and vanilla and mix at low speed until blended. Add remaining flour mixture and mix at low speed until smooth.</step>
    <step>5. Spoon batter into prepared muffin cups, filling almost to top. Bake until tester inserted in center of 1 cake comes out clean, about 25 minutes. Cool in pans on racks.</step>
    <step>6. Pour remaining shredded coconut into 9-inch-square baking dish. Run small knife around edges of pans and unmold cakes. Spread frosting on cakes and invert each into coconut to coat frosting liberally. Garnish with Jordan almonds, if desired.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Chickpea, Eggplant, and Tomato Tarts</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['1 (1-lb) eggplant'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 3/4 teaspoons salt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 cup extra-virgin olive oil'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 medium onion</ingredient>
    <ingredient>halved lengthwise</ingredient>
    <ingredient>then cut crosswise into 1/2-inch-thick slices'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 Turkish or 1/2 California bay leaf'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 garlic cloves</ingredient>
    <ingredient>minced'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 (14 1/2- to 16-oz) can stewed tomatoes</ingredient>
    <ingredient>drained</ingredient>
    <ingredient>reserving juice</ingredient>
    <ingredient>and coarsely chopped'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 teaspoon paprika (not hot)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/8 teaspoon ground cumin'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 (15- to 19-oz) can chickpeas</ingredient>
    <ingredient>rinsed and drained'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 teaspoon sugar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 1/2 teaspoons black pepper'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 cup coarsely chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'6 (17- by 12-inch) phyllo sheets (from a 1-lb package)</ingredient>
    <ingredient>thawed if frozen'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'garnish: fresh flat-leaf parsley leaves</ingredient>
    <ingredient>torn into pieces']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Peel eggplant and cut into 1/2-inch cubes. Toss with 1 teaspoon salt in a large bowl and let stand 15 minutes, then rinse in a colander under cold water and squeeze out excess water.</step>
    <step>2. Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a 12-inch heavy skillet over moderately high heat until hot but not smoking, then cook onion with bay leaf, stirring occasionally, until golden, about 5 minutes. Add 1 tablespoon oil, eggplant, and garlic and cook, stirring, until eggplant is tender, 8 to 10 minutes. Add tomatoes (without juice), paprika, and cumin and cook, stirring, 3 minutes. Add reserved tomato juice, chickpeas, sugar, 1/2 teaspoon pepper, and remaining 3/4 teaspoon salt and simmer, stirring occasionally, until filling is thickened and most of liquid is evaporated, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in parsley, then discard bay leaf.</step>
    <step>3. Put oven rack in middle position and preheat oven to 425°F. Line a large baking sheet with foil.</step>
    <step>4. Unroll phyllo and cover stack with plastic wrap and a dampened kitchen towel. Keeping remaining phyllo covered, lightly brush 1 phyllo sheet with some of remaining oil and top with 2 more sheets, brushing each with oil. Sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon pepper, then cut stack in half crosswise with a sharp knife. Spoon 1 cup filling into center of each half. Crumple edges of phyllo and shape into a crescent, leaving filling exposed, then transfer to baking sheet using a spatula. Make 2 more tarts in same manner, arranging about 1/2 inch apart on baking sheet.</step>
    <step>5. Bake, rotating baking sheet 180 degrees after 10 minutes, until edges of tarts are golden, 15 to 20 minutes total. Serve immediately.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Pineapple-Chile Margarita</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['8 (3/4- to 1-inch) chunks peeled pineapple'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'4 slices red jalapeño chile with seeds'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 cup 100% blue agave silver tequila'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 tablespoons fresh lime juice'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 tablespoons Simple Syrup'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tablespoons Cointreau or other orange liqueur'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 cups ice cubes</ingredient>
    <ingredient>divided']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Place pineapple chunks and red jalapeño slices in medium bowl. Press firmly on solids with muddler or back of wooden spoon until mashed. Mix in tequila, lime juice, Simple Syrup , and Cointreau, then 1 cup ice. Stir to blend well. Strain into large glass measuring cup. Divide remaining ice between 2 tall glasses. Pour Margarita mixture over.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Mustard-Seed-Crusted Burgers with Horseradish Slaw</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['1/2 cup mayonnaise'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 cup sour cream'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 tablespoons prepared horseradish'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 1/3 pounds ground beef'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 cup yellow mustard seeds</ingredient>
    <ingredient>coarsely crushed'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 tablespoon vegetable oil'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'4 kaiser rolls</ingredient>
    <ingredient>halved horizontally'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 cups (about 6 ounces) thinly sliced iceberg lettuce']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Whisk mayonnaise, sour cream, and horseradish in medium bowl to blend. Season with salt and pepper. Form ground beef into four 1/3-pound burgers, each about 3 3/4 inches in diameter and 1/2 inch thick. Sprinkle both sides of burgers with salt and pepper. Spread mustard seeds on small plate. Press both sides of burgers firmly into mustard seeds.</step>
    <step>2. Heat vegetable oil in heavy large skillet over medium-high heat. Add burgers and cook until brown on both sides and pink in center, about 4 minutes per side. Arrange roll bottoms on each of 4 plates. Transfer burgers to roll bottoms. Stir lettuce into horseradish mixture to coat. Divide lettuce mixture atop hamburgers. Cover each burger with roll top and serve.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Cracked Black Pepper Pull-Apart Biscuits</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['4 tablespoons (1/2 stick) unsalted butter</ingredient>
    <ingredient>melted</ingredient>
    <ingredient>divided</ingredient>
    <ingredient>plus 1/2 pound (2 sticks)</ingredient>
    <ingredient>cut into pieces</ingredient>
    <ingredient>softened'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'4 cups all-purpose flour'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 cups cake flour'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tablespoons baking powder'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 tablespoon freshly ground black pepper'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 teaspoons kosher salt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 teaspoon baking soda'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 cup vegetable shortening'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 1/2 cups buttermilk'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 teaspoon flaky sea salt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Two (8") cake pans or one (9x13") baking dish']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Preheat oven to 425°F. Grease cake pans or baking dish with 1 Tbsp. melted butter.</step>
    <step>2. Combine all-purpose flour, cake flour, baking powder, pepper, kosher salt, and baking soda in a large bowl. Add shortening and 1/2 pound softened butter. Using your hands or a fork, mix just until mixture is coarse and mealy. Stir in buttermilk just until a shaggy dough forms.</step>
    <step>3. Divide dough into 16 heaping 1/3-cup portions. Place 7 around the perimeter and 1 in the center of each cake pan (or nestle all 16 into baking dish). Brush biscuits with remaining 3 Tbsp. melted butter, sprinkle with sea salt, and bake until puffed and golden brown, 35–40 minutes. Let cool in pan 10 minutes. Invert onto a wire rack, then reinvert. Serve warm or at room temperature.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Pistachio Cake</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['3/4 cup shelled natural pistachios (4 ounces)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 cup all-purpose flour'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 teaspoons baking powder'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 teaspoon ground cardamom'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 teaspoon salt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 cup whole milk'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 teaspoon vanilla'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 1/2 sticks (3/4 cup) unsalted butter</ingredient>
    <ingredient>softened'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 cup sugar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 large eggs']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Preheat oven to 350°F. Butter a 13- by 9-inch metal cake pan, then line bottom with wax paper. Butter paper and dust pan with some flour, knocking out excess.</step>
    <step>2. Pulse pistachios in a food processor until finely ground (be careful not to overprocess into a paste). Add 1 cup flour, baking powder, cardamom, and salt and pulse once or twice to mix.</step>
    <step>3. Combine milk and vanilla in a measuring cup.</step>
    <step>4. Beat together butter and sugar in a large bowl with an electric mixer until pale and fluffy. Add eggs 1 at a time, beating well after each addition. Alternately add pistachio flour and milk in batches, beginning and ending with flour, and mix at low speed until just combined.</step>
    <step>5. Spread batter evenly in cake pan and bake in middle of oven until a tester comes out clean, about 20 minutes. Cool in pan on a rack 10 minutes, then run a thin knife around sides of cake and invert onto rack. Remove paper and reinvert cake onto a platter. Cut into squares and serve warm or at room temperature.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
