  <title>Vietnamese Pork Chops</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['1 small shallot</ingredient>
    <ingredient>finely chopped'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/3 cup (packed) light brown sugar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 cup fish sauce (such as nam pla or nuoc nam)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tablespoons unseasoned rice vinegar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'4 1" thick-cut bone-in pork chops (about 2 1/2 pounds total)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 tablespoon vegetable oil'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Kosher salt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'lime halves (for serving)']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Whisk shallot, brown sugar, fish sauce, vinegar, and pepper in a shallow dish. Using a fork, pierce pork chops all over (to allow marinade to penetrate faster) and add to marinade in dish. Turn to coat. Cover and let pork chops marinate at room temperature, turning occasionally, 20 minutes.</step>
    <step>2. Remove pork chops from marinade, scraping off excess (reserve marinade for sauce). Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Lightly season pork chops with salt. Cook until browned and cooked through, about 4 minutes per side. Let pork chops rest 10 minutes before serving.</step>
    <step>3. Meanwhile, bring marinade to a boil in a small saucepan and cook until reduced to 1/4 cup, about 4 minutes. Serve pork chops with reduced marinade and lime halves.</step>
    <step>4. DO AHEAD: Chops can be marinated 1 day ahead. Chill, turning bag occasionally.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Bean Lavash Triangles</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['¼ cup plus 2 tbsp [90 ml] sunflower oil or other neutral oil</ingredient>
    <ingredient>plus more as needed'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'½ yellow onion</ingredient>
    <ingredient>finely diced'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 (15.5 oz [440 g]) cans cranberry or pinto beans</ingredient>
    <ingredient>drained</ingredient>
    <ingredient>or 3 cups [720 g] cooked homemade beans'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 tsp kosher salt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'½ tsp ground black pepper'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tbsp chopped cilantro'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 tbsp chopped dill'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'4 large sheets homemade or store-bought (see note) lavash']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. To make the filling, in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat, warm 2 Tbsp [30 ml] of the oil. Stir in the onion, lower the heat to medium, and cook, stirring occasionally, until translucent, about 4 minutes. Stir in the beans, salt, and pepper and cook until the beans absorb some of the seasoning and are hot all the way through, about 2 minutes. Turn off the heat.</step>
    <step>2. Using a potato masher or an immersion blender, mash the beans in the pot to make a paste. Mash in the cilantro and dill and let cool to room temperature.</step>
    <step>3. Cut the lavash into 12 strips 3 in [7.5 cm] thick and about 12 in [30.5 cm] long. Keep cut lavash covered or in a plastic bag so the strips don’t dry out.</step>
    <step>4. To shape each triangle, position a strip of lavash in front of you vertically. Place about 2 Tbsp of bean paste at the bottom end of the strip. Pull the bottom left corner of the strip to the right side, about 3 in [7.5 cm] up from the bottom, to create a triangle that encases the beans. Next, take the bottom right corner of the triangle and fold it away from you to the left edge of the lavash to enclose the filling, “rolling” the triangle up the lavash and adding a layer to the triangle. Continue to fold the triangle all the way up the strip until all of the lavash is used up. If any extra lavash hangs off the edge, trim it with scissors. Once finished, place the triangle seam-side down and repeat with the remaining strips and filling.</step>
    <step>5. Line a plate with paper towels. Heat 2 Tbsp of oil in a large sauté pan over medium-high heat. Place half of the triangles seam-side down in the oil and fry until golden brown on one side, about 1 minute, adjusting the heat as needed to prevent the lavash from burning. Flip the triangles over to brown the other side, 30 seconds to 1 minute more. Transfer to the paper towel–lined plate and repeat with the remaining oil and triangles. If the pan seems too dry after flipping over the triangles, add more oil. Let cool slightly before serving. Leftovers keep, refrigerated, for up to 3 days and can be reheated in a toaster oven for 3 to 5 minutes until hot in the center.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Ricotta and Sage Fried Meatballs</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['1/3 cup whole-milk ricotta'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tablespoons vegetable oil plus more for frying'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 garlic cloves</ingredient>
    <ingredient>minced'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 teaspoons fennel seeds</ingredient>
    <ingredient>toasted</ingredient>
    <ingredient>lightly crushed'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 1/4 teaspoons dried sage'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 teaspoon kosher salt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'8 ounces ground pork'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'24 fresh sage leaves'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3/4 cup all-purpose flour'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 large egg</ingredient>
    <ingredient>beaten to blend'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 cups panko (Japanese breadcrumbs)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Marinara sauce</ingredient>
    <ingredient>warmed (optional)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'A deep-fry thermometer']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Line a baking sheet with parchment. Stir ricotta and 2 tablespoons oil in a medium bowl until smooth. Mix in garlic and next 5 ingredients. Add pork</step>
    <step>2. gently fold until just combined.</step>
    <step>3. Scoop out scant tablespoonfuls of pork mixture. With dampened hands, roll portions between your palms into 1" balls</step>
    <step>4. place on sheet. Wrap 1 sage leaf around each ball</step>
    <step>5. press gently to adhere.</step>
    <step>6. Place flour, egg, and panko in 3 separate medium bowls. Working with 1 meatball at a time, dredge in flour, rolling between your hands to remove excess flour. Dip in egg</step>
    <step>7. allow excess to drip back into bowl. Roll meatball in panko, pressing gently to coat. Return to sheet.</step>
    <step>8. Attach deep-fry thermometer to side of a large heavy pot. Pour in oil to a depth of 2". Heat over medium heat until thermometer registers 350°F. Line another baking sheet with parchment</step>
    <step>9. set a wire rack inside.</step>
    <step>10. Working in batches, fry meatballs, turning often, until light golden and crisp, about 1 minute (they will finish cooking in the oven). Transfer to wire rack</step>
    <step>11. let cool. DO AHEAD: Meatballs can be fried 1 month ahead. Store airtight in freezer.</step>
    <step>12. Preheat oven to 275°F. Bake meatballs in batches on wire rack in baking sheet until cooked through, about 15 minutes. Serve, or keep warm in oven for up to 45 minutes.</step>
    <step>13. Pour some warm marinara, if using, into a small bowl. Serve alongside for dipping.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Sheet-Pan Crispy Fish Tacos with Chili-Roasted Corn</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['1 1/2 cups pumpkin seeds (pepitas)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 1/2 cups panko (Japanese breadcrumbs)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 1/4 teaspoons kosher salt</ingredient>
    <ingredient>divided'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper</ingredient>
    <ingredient>divided'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3–4 skinless mild fish fillets (such as red snapper</ingredient>
    <ingredient>striped bass</ingredient>
    <ingredient>or halibut; each 3/4" thick</ingredient>
    <ingredient>about 1 pound total)</ingredient>
    <ingredient>pin bones removed'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 large eggs'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 cup mayonnaise</ingredient>
    <ingredient>divided'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 teaspoons chili powder</ingredient>
    <ingredient>divided'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Nonstick vegetable cooking spray'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'4 ears of corn</ingredient>
    <ingredient>husked'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'12 taco-size corn tortillas'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Shredded green cabbage</ingredient>
    <ingredient>sliced avocado</ingredient>
    <ingredient>cilantro leaves with tender stems</ingredient>
    <ingredient>pickled jalapeño slices</ingredient>
    <ingredient>hot sauce</ingredient>
    <ingredient>and lime wedges (for serving)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'An ovenproof wire rack that fits inside an 18x13" rimmed baking sheet; 2 (18x13") rimmed baking sheets']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Arrange racks in upper and lower thirds of oven and preheat to 350°F. Pulse pumpkin seeds in a food processor until finely chopped. Transfer to rimmed baking sheet and toss with panko. Toast until lightly browned, 10–12 minutes. Transfer to a large plate and stir in 3/4 tsp. salt and 1/4 tsp. pepper</step>
    <step>2. wipe off sheet.</step>
    <step>3. Meanwhile, cut each fillet in half lengthwise. Slice each piece on a diagonal into 3/4" strips. Whisk eggs, 1/4 cup mayonnaise, 1 1/2 tsp. chili powder, 3/4 tsp. salt, and 1/4 tsp. pepper in a medium bowl. Set wire rack into rimmed baking sheet. Spray with cooking spray.</step>
    <step>4. Dredge each piece of fish in mayonnaise mixture, then roll in pumpkin-panko mixture, pressing to adhere. Arrange in a single layer on prepared rack. Spread corn with remaining 1/4 cup mayonnaise. Sprinkle with remaining 1 1/2 tsp. chili powder, 3/4 tsp. salt, and 1/4 tsp. pepper and arrange on second baking sheet. Place baking sheet with fish on upper rack of oven and corn on lower rack. Bake fish until opaque and flesh flakes apart when pierced with a paring knife, 18–22 minutes, and bake corn, turning once halfway through, until tender, about 20 minutes.</step>
    <step>5. Meanwhile, working one at a time, warm tortillas with tongs directly over a gas burner, turning them often, until lightly charred and puffed in spots, about 1 minute per side. (If you don't have a gas stove, wrap tortillas in foil and heat in a 350°F oven until warmed through, or wrap in damp paper towels and microwave in 20-second bursts until warm.) Transfer to a plate and cover with a kitchen towel to keep warm.</step>
    <step>6. Divide fish among tortillas and top with cabbage, avocado, cilantro, jalapeños, and hot sauce. Serve with corn and lime wedges alongside.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Mustard Chicken Stew</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['1 whole head garlic'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Extra virgin olive oil'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Fine sea salt and freshly ground pepper'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'One 3- to 3 1/2-pound whole free-range chicken</ingredient>
    <ingredient>cut in 8 serving pieces (2 breasts</ingredient>
    <ingredient>2 thighs</ingredient>
    <ingredient>2 wings</ingredient>
    <ingredient>and 2 drumsticks</ingredient>
    <ingredient>with bones and skin)</ingredient>
    <ingredient>thawed if frozen'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'6 medium red onions</ingredient>
    <ingredient>about 2 pounds'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'One 28- to 32-ounce can good-quality whole peeled tomatoes</ingredient>
    <ingredient>drained'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 tablespoon fresh thyme or 1 1/2 teaspoons dried thyme'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 bay leaves'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'A good pinch of ground chile powder'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/3 cup dry white wine'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 tablespoons old-fashioned Dijon mustard with whole mustard seeds (substitute 1/4 cup regular Dijon mustard)']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Preheat the oven to 400°F.</step>
    <step>2. Peel the outer layers of skin from the head of garlic until you reach the individual cloves. Slice off the top of the head so the flesh of each clove is exposed. Put the head of garlic on a sheet of foil, drizzle with olive oil, season with salt and pepper, and close the foil into a pouch. Bake for 45 minutes, until the flesh of each clove is light brown and very soft when tested with the tip of a knife.</step>
    <step>3. Once you've slipped the garlic into the oven, heat 1 teaspoon olive oil over medium heat in a large heavy pot or Dutch oven. Working in two batches, arrange the chicken in the pot, skin side down, in a single layer. Season with salt and pepper and cook for 3 minutes on each side, until golden. (Be careful not to burn yourself with the sizzling chicken fat.)</step>
    <step>4. While the chicken is browning, peel and quarter the onions. Set the meat aside on a plate and pour out the excess chicken fat. Put the onions in the pot and cook for 5 minutes, until softened, stirring regularly.</step>
    <step>5. Add the tomatoes, thyme, bay leaves, and ground chile powder, and arrange the chicken over the vegetables. Pour in the wine and bring to a simmer. Cover and cook over medium-low heat for 40 minutes, stirring from time to time to make sure the vegetables don’t stick to the bottom.</step>
    <step>6. Remove the garlic from the oven, open the pouch, and let stand until cool enough to handle. Squeeze the garlic out of each clove into a small bowl, and mash with a fork to form a paste. Taste and adjust the seasoning. Cover and set aside.</step>
    <step>7. When the chicken is cooked, spoon the mustard in the pot and stir to blend into the sauce. Turn the heat up to medium-high and cook uncovered for 10 minutes, stirring regularly, until the sauce is thick enough to cling to the meat. Taste the sauce and adjust the seasoning.</step>
    <step>8. Cover and keep over low heat until ready to serve. Serve over rice or pasta (fish out the bay leaves, or simply tell your dining companions not to eat them), with garlic paste on the side. The stew and garlic can be prepared up to a day ahead, covered, and refrigerated. Reheat the stew over gentle heat, and bring the garlic paste to room temperature before serving. The leftover sauce from the stew is splendid on pasta.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Basic Pull-Apart Challah</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['2 ounces (1/4 cup) active dry yeast'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 cups plus 3 tablespoons granulated sugar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'6 cups warm water (90° to 100°F)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 cup kosher salt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'6 pounds high-gluten (bread) or all-purpose flour'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'4 large eggs</ingredient>
    <ingredient>separated'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 1/4 cups canola oil'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Cooking spray'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 cup sesame seeds'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 cup poppy seeds']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Bloom the yeast: Dissolve the yeast and 3 tablespoons sugar in 2 cups of the warm water in a medium bowl</step>
    <step>2. set aside to bloom. If the yeast doesn't bloom after 5 minutes discard the mixture and start over.</step>
    <step>3. Place the salt, flour, and the remaining 2 cups sugar together in a very large bowl and stir together. Add the 4 egg yolks. Make a well in the middle and add the yeast mixture and the remaining 4 cups water. Start kneading together</step>
    <step>4. add 1/2 cup canola oil. Knead for 10 minutes, adding 1/2 cup canola oil, a small amount at a time, to create a workable dough. The dough will become a cohesive mass yet be a bit sticky. Rub a little of the remaining 1/4 cup canola oil over the top and sides of the dough. Loosely cover the dough with a kitchen towel and place the bowl in a warm spot for 15 minutes.</step>
    <step>5. After 15 minutes, the dough will have relaxed a bit and should be easier to work with. Lightly oil your hands and knead the dough again until smooth and satiny, 2 to 3 minutes. Rub a little oil over the top and sides of the dough. Cover with a kitchen towel and place the bowl in a medium garbage bag. Place the open end loosely underneath the bowl to trap air. Let the dough rise in a warm dark corner of your kitchen until doubled in size, about 1 hour.</step>
    <step>6. Uncover the dough. With lightly oiled hands, punch the dough down to release air. Cover again with the bag, loosely tucked under, and let rise for 1 hour.</step>
    <step>7. Divide the dough into five equal parts, about 2 pounds each. Preheat oven to 375°F. Spray five 9-inch round baking pans with cooking spray.</step>
    <step>8. Place one piece of dough on a smooth work surface. Squeeze out any air bubbles from the dough and roll in into a 12-inch rope. If the dough is sticking, lightly spray your work surface with cooking spray. Cut the rope into eight equal pieces. Roll each piece into a ball. Place one ball in the center of the prepared pan and surround it with the remaining balls. Repeat with the remaining pieces of dough so you have five pans of challah. Loosely cover each pan with a kitchen towel or plastic wrap and let rise 15 minutes. (If you can't fit all the pans in your oven at once and you want your challahs to be as beautiful as possible, shape the remaining dough while the first round of challahs are in the oven so they don't see rise for too much longer than 15 minutes before baking.)</step>
    <step>9. Beat the egg whites with 1 teaspoon water in a small bowl and brush the challahs. Sprinkle each with sesame or poppy seeds or a combination of the two.</step>
    <step>10. Bake for 10 minutes. Reduce the temperature to 350°F and bake until tops are dark golden brown, 35 to 45 minutes more. Let cool 15 minutes before serving warm, or cool completely on a wire rack.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Soba Salad with Miso Dressing</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['Kosher salt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'5 tablespoons white miso paste'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 cup chopped peeled fresh ginger'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 cup soy sauce'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 tablespoons fresh lime juice'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 large egg'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 cup vegetable oil'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Freshly ground black pepper'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 pound soba noodles'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'4 medium carrots</ingredient>
    <ingredient>peeled and coarsely grated (about 4 cups)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 bunches scallions</ingredient>
    <ingredient>thinly sliced on the bias (about 2 1/2 cups)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 bunches radishes</ingredient>
    <ingredient>thinly sliced (about 4 cups)']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Bring 4 quarts water to a boil in a large pot and add 2 tablespoons salt.</step>
    <step>2. Meanwhile, make the dressing: Combine the miso paste, ginger, soy sauce, and lime juice in a blender and blend, at medium speed until smooth. Add the egg and blend until combined. With the motor running, slowly add the oil. Once the dressing is smooth, add pepper to taste</step>
    <step>3. you won't need salt, because the miso and soy sauce are salty. (The dressing can be made up to 1 day ahead and refrigerated, covered.)</step>
    <step>4. Add the soba noodles to the boiling water and cook, stirring often, until al dente. Drain the noodles and rinse well under cold running water. Drain well, transfer to a baking sheet, then spread out and let cool.</step>
    <step>5. In a large bowl, combine the noodles with the carrots, scallions, and radishes. Toss with the miso dressing and serve at room temperature or cold. (The soba salad can be made up to 2 hours in advance.)</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Goodnight, Irene Cocktail</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['4 ounces Islay scotch (such as laphroaig</ingredient>
    <ingredient>Caol Ila</ingredient>
    <ingredient>or Ardbeg)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 ounce simple syrup'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'4 dashes Angostura bitters'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 dashes orange bitters'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'An 8-ounce flask']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Pour scotch and simple syrup into an 8-ounce flask. Add Angostura bitters, orange bitters, and 2 ounces water, then shake to combine.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Negroni</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['2 tablespoons (1 ounce) sweet vermouth'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tablespoons (1 ounce) Campari'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tablespoons (1 ounce) dry gin'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 cup ice cubes'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 navel orange peel twist']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. In chilled cocktail shaker or pint glass, stir together vermouth, Campari, gin, and ice until well combined. Strain into a martini glass or ice-filled rocks glass and garnish with orange twist.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Boozy Grapefruit-Pomegranate Gummy Candies</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['1/2 cup fresh grapefruit juice'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/3 cup honey or light agave nectar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 tablespoons Campari'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tablespoons unflavored powdered gelatin'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 cup pomegranate juice'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 cup honey or light agave nectar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 tablespoon grand Marnier'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tablespoons unflavored powdered gelatin'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Sanding sugar (for serving; optional)']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Combine grapefruit juice, honey, Campari, and lemon juice in a small saucepan. Sprinkle gelatin evenly over and let sit until gelatin is softened, 10–15 minutes. Cook over medium-low, stirring constantly, until gelatin is dissolved and mixture is translucent with no visible granules, about 4 minutes (do not boil). Strain into an 8 1/2x4 1/2” loaf pan</step>
    <step>2. chill until firm, 30–40 minutes.</step>
    <step>3. While grapefruit layer is chilling, combine pomegranate juice, honey, lemon juice, and Grand Marnier in a small saucepan. Sprinkle gelatin evenly over and let sit until gelatin is softened, 10–15 minutes. Cook over medium-low, stirring constantly, until gelatin is dissolved and mixture is translucent with no visible granules, about 4 minutes (do not boil). Let mixture cool slightly, then strain over set grapefruit layer and cover with plastic wrap. Chill gummy mixture until completely set, at least 3 hours.</step>
    <step>4. Run a small offset spatula around sides of pan to loosen candy, then gently peel away candy from bottom (be careful not to tear it). Cut into 1" cubes or punch out into desired shapes with canapé or small cookie cutters.</step>
    <step>5. Toss candies in sanding sugar, if desired, just before serving.</step>
    <step>6. Candies can be made 4 days ahead. Keep chilled. Cut just before serving.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Olive-Stuffed Leg of Lamb</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['1 shallot</ingredient>
    <ingredient>chopped'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 garlic cloves</ingredient>
    <ingredient>chopped'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 cup pine nuts'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 cup pitted Kalamata olives'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 cup drained oil-packed anchovies'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 cup finely grated lemon zest'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 cup mint leaves'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 cup parsley leaves'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tablespoons thyme leaves'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 cup olive oil</ingredient>
    <ingredient>plus more'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Kosher salt</ingredient>
    <ingredient>freshly ground pepper'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'0 freshly ground pepper'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 3–4 pound piece butterflied boneless leg of lamb'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>"2 cups soft sheep's-milk cheese or goat cheese"</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 garlic clove</ingredient>
    <ingredient>finely grated'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 teaspoons finely grated lemon zest'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 teaspoon thyme leaves'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 cup plus 1 tablespoon olive oil'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Kosher salt</ingredient>
    <ingredient>freshly ground pepper'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'0 freshly ground pepper'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 bunch watercress</ingredient>
    <ingredient>trimmed'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Flatbread (for serving)']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Preheat oven to 425°. Finely chop shallot, garlic, nuts, olives, anchovies, lemon zest, mint, parsley, and thyme in a food processor. With motor running, stream in 1/2 cup oil</step>
    <step>2. process until blended. Season stuffing with salt and pepper.</step>
    <step>3. Unfold lamb on a cutting board and season with salt and pepper. Spread stuffing over top</step>
    <step>4. roll up lamb from left to right. Position seam side down and tie closed with kitchen twine at 1 1/2" intervals crosswise, then once lengthwise. Transfer to a wire rack set inside a rimmed baking sheet</step>
    <step>5. drizzle with oil.</step>
    <step>6. Roast until lamb is starting to brown, 30–40 minutes. Reduce temperature to 325° and continue to roast until a thermometer inserted into thickest part registers 125°, 35–45 minutes longer. Remove lamb from oven and tent with foil</step>
    <step>7. let rest 15–20 minutes.</step>
    <step>8. Do ahead: Lamb can be stuffed and tied 1 day ahead</step>
    <step>9. cover and chill. Bring to room temperature before roasting.</step>
    <step>10. While lamb rests, process cheese, garlic, lemon zest, and thyme in food processor until light, fluffy, and smooth. With motor running, stream in 1/2 cup oil</step>
    <step>11. process until blended. Season herbed cheese with salt and pepper.</step>
    <step>12. Dress watercress in a large bowl with lemon juice and remaining 1 tablespoon oil</step>
    <step>13. season with salt and pepper. Slice lamb and serve with watercress, herbed cheese, and flatbread.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Raspberry Linzer Torte Bars</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['Sugar Cookie Dough'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Vegetable oil cooking spray'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'6 tablespoons raspberry preserves'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tablespoons sliced almonds']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Heat oven to 350°F. Coat a 9" x 13" pan with cooking spray. Cut dough in half</step>
    <step>2. roll out 1 half into a 9-by-13-inch rectangle</step>
    <step>3. press into bottom of pan. Spread preserves over dough</step>
    <step>4. sprinkle with almonds. Roll out remaining dough into a 4 1/2-by-6 1/2-inch rectangle. Cut dough into 1/2-inch strips with a fluted pastry cutter. Crisscross strips over raspberry-almond layer in a lattice pattern. Bake until strips are light brown and firm, 18 to 20 minutes</step>
    <step>5. cool 5 minutes. Cut into 1-to 1 1/2-inch bars.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Liquid Iron</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['2 stalks red Swiss chard</ingredient>
    <ingredient>chopped'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 cup chopped spinach leaves'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 cup chopped purple kale'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 teaspoon loose green tea leaves'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'6 cups still water']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Place the chard, spinach, kale, and tea leaves in a blender with 1 cup of the water. Puree until fairly smooth, for about 1 minute.</step>
    <step>2. Strain through a fine-mesh sieve into a large pitcher, using a ladle or rubber spatula to extract as much juice as possible. Add the remaining water, stir gently, and serve.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Savory Pumpkin Pie Soup with Cinnamon Marshmallows, Pepita Streusel, and Whipped Crème Fraîche</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['10 whole cloves'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 whole star anise'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 stick cinnamon'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 whole allspice berries'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'5 whole black peppercorns'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 (1 1/2-inch) piece fresh ginger</ingredient>
    <ingredient>cut into 4 pieces'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'4 tablespoons (1/2 stick) unsalted butter'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 medium onion</ingredient>
    <ingredient>diced'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'5 cloves garlic</ingredient>
    <ingredient>thinly sliced'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 stalks celery</ingredient>
    <ingredient>diced'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 medium leek (white and pale green parts only)</ingredient>
    <ingredient>thoroughly washed and diced'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 (15-ounce) cans solid-pack pumpkin (not pie filling)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 teaspoon freshly ground nutmeg'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 cup mini marshmallows'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3/4 cup all-purpose flour'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 cup packed light brown sugar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 teaspoon kosher salt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'8 tablespoons (1 stick) cold unsalted butter</ingredient>
    <ingredient>cut into 1/2-inch pieces'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 cup untoasted</ingredient>
    <ingredient>unsalted pepitas (pumpkin seeds)</ingredient>
    <ingredient>coarsely chopped'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 cup heavy cream'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 cup crème fraîche'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 (8-inch) squares cheesecloth; kitchen string; blender; 1 large baking sheet; parchment paper']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Wrap the cloves, star anise, cinnamon stick, allspice berries, peppercorns, and fresh ginger in cheesecloth and secure with kitchen string.</step>
    <step>2. In a large heavy pot over moderate heat, melt the butter. Add the onions, garlic, celery, and leeks and sauté until translucent, 5 to 6 minutes. Add the pumpkin, 2 quarts water, and the spice package and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to moderately low and simmer uncovered until the vegetables are tender, about 30 minutes.</step>
    <step>3. Remove and discard the spice package. Working in small batches, ladle the soup into a blender and purée until smooth. Transfer to a clean large pot then sprinkle with nutmeg and season with salt and pepper. Cover and keep warm until ready to serve. DO AHEAD: Soup can be made in advance and refrigerated, in an airtight container, up to 3 days. Reheat in a large pot over moderate heat, stirring occasionally.</step>
    <step>4. In a large bowl or resealable plastic bag, combine marshmallows and cinnamon and gently toss to coat the marshmallows in cinnamon. DO AHEAD: Marshmallows can be prepared in advance and stored, in a resealable plastic bag or an airtight container at room temperature, up to 3 days.</step>
    <step>5. Arrange a rack in the middle of the oven and preheat to 350°F. Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper.</step>
    <step>6. In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, brown sugar, and salt. Add the butter and, using your hands, rub the ingredients together until the texture resembles coarse cornmeal. Add the pepitas and toss to combine. Spread the mixture on the prepared baking sheet and bake until golden brown, 10 to 12 minutes. Transfer the streusel to a rack to cool, then break it into roughly 1-inch pieces. DO AHEAD: Streusel can be made in advance and stored, in an airtight container at room temperature, up to 3 days.</step>
    <step>7. In a medium bowl, combine the heavy cream and crème fraîche. Whisk until light and fluffy. Season with salt and pepper. DO AHEAD: Whipped crème fraîche can be made in advance and refrigerated, in an airtight container, up to 2 hours.</step>
    <step>8. Ladle the warm soup into bowls and garnish with the streusel, marshmallows, and dollops of whipped crème fraîche.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Pimiento Cheeseburgers</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['1 small white onion</ingredient>
    <ingredient>grated'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'8 ounces sharp Cheddar cheese</ingredient>
    <ingredient>grated'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'4 ounces mild Cheddar cheese</ingredient>
    <ingredient>grated'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>"1/2 cup good-quality mayonnaise (I prefer Duke's or JFg®)"</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'One 2-ounce jar diced pimientos</ingredient>
    <ingredient>drained'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Freshly ground black pepper'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 pounds 80% lean ground chuck</ingredient>
    <ingredient>or 1 1/2 pounds 80% lean ground chuck plus 8 ounces 90% lean ground sirloin'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Kosher salt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'6 hamburger buns</ingredient>
    <ingredient>preferably onion flavored'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Pickled jalapeño chile slices']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. In a medium bowl, mix together the onion, both cheeses, mayonnaise, and pimientos. If you need additional mayonnaise to make it creamy, add a little bit at a time. Grind copious amounts of black pepper and stir that into the cheese mixture.</step>
    <step>2. Divide the ground beef into 6 equal portions and shape into patties about 3/4 inch thick. Remember to put a slight indentation into the center of each patty. Season both sides of the burgers liberally with salt and pepper.</step>
    <step>3. Oil the grill racks. Preheat your grill using all burners set on high and with the lid closed for 10 to 12 minutes.</step>
    <step>4. Place the burgers on the grill and lower the heat to medium. Grill for about 5 minutes. Turn the patties and continue grilling until they reach your desired doneness, about 4 additional minutes for medium, 6 minutes for medium-well. During the last 2 minutes of cooking time, add the buns, cut side down. At the last minute before taking the hamburgers off the grill, put a generous spoonful of pimiento cheese on each. Take the buns from the grill, place on a platter, set a burger on each bun bottom, add pickled jalapeños on top of the pimiento cheese, and serve.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Bucatini With Walnut-Parsley Pesto</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['1 cup walnuts'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'6 pickled Calabrian chiles or 1 Fresno chile with seeds'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 small garlic clove</ingredient>
    <ingredient>finely grated'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 1/2 ounces Parmesan</ingredient>
    <ingredient>finely grated (about 1 1/2 cups)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/3 cup olive oil'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 cup chopped fresh parsley</ingredient>
    <ingredient>plus more'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Kosher salt</ingredient>
    <ingredient>freshly ground pepper'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3/4 pound bucatini or spaghetti']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Preheat oven to 350°F. Toast walnuts on a rimmed baking sheet, tossing occasionally, until fragrant and slightly darkened, 8–10 minutes. Let cool.</step>
    <step>2. Pulse 3/4 cup walnuts in a food processor or blender until very finely chopped (but not pasty). Reserve remaining walnuts for serving. Remove stems from chiles</step>
    <step>3. add to food processor. Pulse until finely chopped. Transfer walnut mixture to a medium bowl and stir in garlic, Parmesan, oil, and 1 cup parsley. Season pesto with salt and pepper.</step>
    <step>4. Cook pasta in a large pot of boiling salted water, stirring occasionally, until al dente. Drain, reserving 1 cup pasta cooking liquid. Return pasta to pot and add pesto along with 1/2 cup pasta cooking liquid. Toss, adding splashes of cooking liquid as needed, until pesto coats pasta and sauce is glossy.</step>
    <step>5. Crush reserved walnuts with the flat side of a knife. Divide pasta among bowls and top with walnuts and more parsley.</step>
    <step>6. Pesto can be made 2 days ahead. Cover and chill.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Turkey Congee With Crispy Shiitake Mushrooms</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['1 (3–4-pound) turkey carcass'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 medium onion</ingredient>
    <ingredient>unpeeled</ingredient>
    <ingredient>quartered'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 (2-inch) piece ginger</ingredient>
    <ingredient>peeled</ingredient>
    <ingredient>thinly sliced'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 (2-inch) piece cinnamon</ingredient>
    <ingredient>whacked into pieces'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 star anise pod'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 cup long-grain rice</ingredient>
    <ingredient>rinsed well'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Kosher salt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 tablespoons vegetable oil'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'6 ounces shiitake mushrooms</ingredient>
    <ingredient>stems removed</ingredient>
    <ingredient>thinly sliced'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 tablespoon soy sauce'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Freshly ground black pepper'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Cilantro leaves with tender stems and chili oil (for serving)']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Bring turkey, onion, ginger, cinnamon, star anise, and 14 cups cold water to a boil in a large heavy pot. Reduce heat and simmer gently, turning turkey over halfway through, until liquid is reduced to 8 cups, 50–65 minutes. Discard carcass</step>
    <step>2. strain stock through a fine-mesh sieve into a medium saucepan.</step>
    <step>3. Add rice to stock and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer, stirring occasionally, until soup begins to thicken, 35–45 minutes (make sure to stir the bottom of pot to prevent rice from sticking). Continue to cook, stirring constantly, until rice begins to break into smaller pieces and mixture resembles the consistency of oatmeal, 10–15 minutes longer</step>
    <step>4. season congee with salt.</step>
    <step>5. Meanwhile, heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high. Cook mushrooms, tossing occasionally, until browned and crisp, 6–8 minutes. Remove from heat and add soy sauce</step>
    <step>6. season generously with pepper.</step>
    <step>7. Divide congee among bowls. Top with crispy mushrooms and cilantro and drizzle with chili oil.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Jack-O'-Lantern</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['2 tablespoons shortening'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tablespoons flour'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 recipe Chocolate Cake Batter'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 recipe Creamy White Frosting'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'green gel or paste food color'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Orange gel or paste food color'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 small waffle ice cream cone'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'4 ounces (1/2 cup) black fondant'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Black decorating sugar</ingredient>
    <ingredient>for sprinkling'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Two 6-inch half-sphere cake pans (such as Wilton Sports Ball set) or two 1 1/2-quart'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'ovenproof bowls'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Waxed or parchment paper'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Toothpicks'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Wire cooling racks'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'glass measuring cup'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Small offset spatula'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Cake plate or 4-inch round cardboard base (optional)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Plastic straw'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 decorating bags</ingredient>
    <ingredient>#70 leaf tip</ingredient>
    <ingredient>and #5 round tip'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Rolling pin'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Small</ingredient>
    <ingredient>sharp knife'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Small plate'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Compote or shallow bowl</ingredient>
    <ingredient>for serving']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Preheat the oven to 350°F. Lightly grease the bottom of each cake pan, then line it with waxed paper or parchment paper and lightly grease and flour the bottom and sides. Divide the batter between the pans and bake the cakes until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, 30 minutes. Cool the cakes completely in the pans on cooling racks and then turn them out onto the racks.</step>
    <step>2. While the cakes are cooling, transfer 1 cup of the frosting to a glass measuring cup. Tint it green (see Decorating Tips). Tint the remaining frosting orange.</step>
    <step>3. Using an offset spatula, spread a thin layer of the orange frosting over the flat surface of 1 cake. Invert the second cake on top of the first, joining the flat surfaces of both domes together. Transfer the assembled cake to the cardboard base, if using, or a cake plate. Cover the cake completely with the rest of the orange frosting.</step>
    <step>4. To make rib indentations as shown in the photo, hold a plastic straw against the cake, curving it from bottom to top. Lift it off, reposition it, and press again. Repeat all around the cake. (Gently incise the ribs with a skewer if you don't have a straw.)</step>
    <step>5. For the stem, invert the ice cream cone and, using a clean spatula, cover it with the green frosting</step>
    <step>6. add more frosting at the top to give the stem a curved tip. Place the stem on the top of the cake.</step>
    <step>7. Fit a decorating bag with a coupler and the leaf tip</step>
    <step>8. add 1 cup of the green frosting to the bag. Referring to the photo, pipe several leaves around the base of the stem. Hold the bag at an angle next to the stem. Squeeze out some frosting, allowing it to fan into a wide base, then decrease the pressure and slowly pull the tip away, lifting slightly, to form a point.</step>
    <step>9. Remove the leaf tip and replace with the round tip. Pipe tendrils around the stem and leaves. Place the tip where you want the tendril to begin. Using even pressure, squeeze out some frosting and move the tip to draw the tendril. Release the pressure and lift the tip when the tendril is the desired length.</step>
    <step>10. Using a rolling pin, roll the fondant to 1/8 inch thick. Referring to the photo and using a small, sharp knife, cut out the features. For the eyes, cut 2 triangles about 1 1/2 inches wide at the base and 1 1/2 inches tall at the center. For the nose, cut another triangle a little smaller than the eyes. Cut the smile to be about 4 inches from tip to tip. You can draw a paper pattern first if you like.</step>
    <step>11. Spread the black sugar on a small plate (large enough to hold the smile) using the back of the spoon. Press each cutout into the sugar and then invert the coated cutout onto the pumpkin to form the face, pressing it into the frosting. Transfer the cake to the serving dish if you have not already done so.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Brisket with Pomegranate-Walnut Sauce and Pistachio Gremolata</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['1 (7-pound) beef brisket with fat</ingredient>
    <ingredient>fat trimmed to 1/4" thickness'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 teaspoons (or more) kosher salt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 teaspoon (or more) freshly ground black pepper'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 head of garlic</ingredient>
    <ingredient>peeled'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 cup walnuts'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tablespoons honey'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 cups pomegranate juice</ingredient>
    <ingredient>divided'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 1/2 cups (packed) mint leaves (about 1 bunch)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 cup shelled roasted</ingredient>
    <ingredient>salted pistachios'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 garlic cloves'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 teaspoons finely grated lemon zest'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 teaspoon kosher salt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/8 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'A large roasting pan']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Season brisket all over with salt and pepper. Transfer to a large 2-gallon resealable plastic bag or bowl (use roasting pan only if necessary).</step>
    <step>2. Purée garlic, walnuts, honey, and 1 cup pomegranate juice in a blender until very smooth. Add remaining 2 cups pomegranate juice and blend until smooth. Pour marinade over brisket. Seal bag or cover bowl tightly with foil. Chill, turning occasionally, at least 24 hours or up to 48 hours.</step>
    <step>3. Transfer brisket and marinade to roasting pan, cover tightly with foil, and let sit at room temperature 1 hour.</step>
    <step>4. Preheat oven to 275°F. Bake brisket, covered, until meat shreds easily with 2 forks, about 5 hours</step>
    <step>5. if meat is still tough, continue cooking, covered, 1 hour.</step>
    <step>6. Transfer brisket to a cutting board and cover loosely with foil. Transfer cooking liquid to a saucepan and spoon off fat from surface. Cook over medium-high heat, skimming off fat and foam as it surfaces, until reduced by two-thirds (you should have about 2 cups sauce). Season with salt and pepper if necessary.</step>
    <step>7. Pulse mint, pistachios, garlic, lemon zest, salt, and pepper in a food processor until coarsely chopped. Drizzle in oil, pulsing until just combined (do not overprocess).</step>
    <step>8. To serve, slice brisket against the grain and transfer to a platter. Spoon sauce over and top with gremolata.</step>
    <step>9. Brisket can be cooked, without slicing, 2 days ahead. Cover and chill</step>
    <step>10. warm before slicing. Sauce can be made 2 days ahead. Cover and chill.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Ginger Champagne Cocktail</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['1/2 cup chopped fresh ginger'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2/3 cup plus 2 tablespoons sugar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 teaspoon Chinese five-spice powder'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 tablespoons chopped crystallized ginger'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'8 whole star anise'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 bottle (750 ml) Champagne or sparkling wine']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Bring ginger, 2/3 cup of sugar and 1/2 cup water to a boil in a small saucepan. Reduce to a simmer</step>
    <step>2. cook until liquid thickens to maple syrup consistency, about 15 minutes. Remove from heat</step>
    <step>3. let cool. Strain syrup</step>
    <step>4. discard ginger. Combine Chinese five-spice powder and remaining 2 tablespoons sugar on a shallow plate. Moisten the rim of Champagne flutes with water and dip in sugar. Drop 1 teaspoon crystallized ginger and 1 star anise into each glass. Add 1 tablespoon syrup and about 3 ounces Champagne.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Raspberry Chocolate French Macaroons</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['6 oz sliced blanched almonds (not slivered; 2 cups)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 1/2 cups confectioners sugar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 large egg whites'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3/4 teaspoon salt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 tablespoons granulated sugar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Red or pink food coloring'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 oz fine-quality bittersweet chocolate (60 to 64% cacao)</ingredient>
    <ingredient>finely chopped'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/3 cup heavy cream'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 tablespoon unsalted butter</ingredient>
    <ingredient>softened'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/16 teaspoon raspberry extract (preferably McCormick brand)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'parchment paper; a gallon-size sealable plastic bag (not pleated)']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper.</step>
    <step>2. Pulse almonds with 1/2 cup confectioners sugar in a food processor until very finely ground, 2 to 3 minutes, then transfer to a bowl. Sift in remaining cup confectioners sugar, stirring to combine.</step>
    <step>3. Beat egg whites with salt in another bowl with an electric mixer at medium speed until they just hold soft peaks. Add granulated sugar, a little at a time, beating, then increase speed to high and continue to beat until whites just hold stiff, glossy peaks. Add drops of food coloring to reach desired shade and mix at low speed until evenly combined. Stir almond mixture into meringue with a rubber spatula until completely incorporated. (Meringue will deflate.)</step>
    <step>4. Spoon batter into bag, pressing out excess air, and snip off 1 corner of plastic bag to create a 1/4-inch opening. Twist bag firmly just above batter, then pipe peaked mounds of batter (the size of a chocolate kiss) onto lined sheets about 1 1/2 inches apart. Let cookies stand, uncovered, at room temperature until tops are no longer sticky and a light crust forms, 20 to 30 minutes.</step>
    <step>5. Meanwhile, put oven racks in upper and lower thirds of oven and preheat oven to 300°F.</step>
    <step>6. Bake cookies, switching position of sheets halfway through baking, until crisp and edges are just slightly darker, 20 to 25 minutes. Cool completely on sheets on racks, about 30 minutes.</step>
    <step>7. Melt chocolate with cream in a metal bowl set over a pan of barely simmering water or in top of a double boiler, stirring until smooth. (Bowl should not touch water.) Remove bowl from heat, then add butter and raspberry extract, stirring until butter is melted. Let stand at room temperature until cooled completely and slightly thickened.</step>
    <step>8. Carefully peel cookies from parchment (they will be fragile). Sandwich a thin layer of ganache (about 1/2 teaspoon) between flat sides of cookies.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Peches Melba</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['6 medium firm-ripe peaches (2 1/4 lb)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 1/3 cups sugar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 cups water'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 (1-inch) piece vanilla bean'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 (12-oz) package frozen raspberries (not in syrup)</ingredient>
    <ingredient>thawed'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 cup sugar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/3 cup water'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 teaspoons fresh lemon juice'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Accompaniment: 2 pt superpremium vanilla ice cream']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Cut a shallow X in bottom of each peach with a sharp paring knife and immerse fruit in a 4-quart heavy pot (preferably wide) of boiling water 30 seconds, then transfer with a slotted spoon to a bowl of ice and cold water to stop cooking. Transfer peaches to a cutting board and peel, starting with cut end, then cut in half, discarding pits.</step>
    <step>2. Combine sugar and water in cleaned pot. Halve vanilla bean lengthwise with a paring knife and scrape seeds into pot, then add pod and bring mixture to a boil, stirring until sugar is dissolved. Add peaches, pitted sides down, to sugar syrup, then reduce heat and poach, covered, at a bare simmer 6 minutes. Turn peaches over and continue to poach, covered, until tender, 5 to 6 minutes more.</step>
    <step>3. Cool peaches in poaching liquid in pot, uncovered, 1 to 1 1/2 hours.</step>
    <step>4. Force raspberries through a fine-mesh sieve into a bowl, pressing hard on solids.</step>
    <step>5. Combine sugar and water in a small heavy saucepan. Cover pan (so condensation will wash any sugar crystals down side of pan) and bring to a boil, then remove lid and boil 2 minutes.</step>
    <step>6. Immediately stir sugar syrup into raspberry purée and cool to room temperature, about 1 hour. Stir in lemon juice. 3Serve peaches over ice cream and drizzled with sauce.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Sponge Candy</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['1 cup sugar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 cup dark corn syrup'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 tablespoon distilled white vinegar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 tablespoon baking soda</ingredient>
    <ingredient>sifted']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Line 9-inch square cake pan with 2-inch-high sides with foil, extending foil over sides. Generously butter foil. Combine sugar, corn syrup and vinegar in heavy large deep saucepan. Stir over medium heat until sugar dissolves. Continue cooking without stirring until clip-on candy thermometer registers 300°F, swirling pan occasionally, about 18 minutes. Remove from heat. Immediately add baking soda and stir until well combined (mixture will foam vigorously). Immediately pour mixture into prepared pan. Cool completely.</step>
    <step>2. Using foil as aid, lift, candy from pan</step>
    <step>3. fold down foil sides. Cut or break candy into large pieces (save any small pieces or shreds to use as a topping for ice cream). (Can be made 1 week ahead. Store airtight at room temperature.)</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Pluot Jam</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['3/4 pound ripe Pluots (about 3 large or 5 small)</ingredient>
    <ingredient>halved</ingredient>
    <ingredient>pitted</ingredient>
    <ingredient>chopped (about 1 1/2 cups)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 tablespoons honey'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'4 teaspoons (or more) balsamic vinegar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 tablespoon (or more) lemon juice'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 teaspoons finely grated lemon peel'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 teaspoon finely minced fresh rosemary'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/8 teaspoon coarse kosher salt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Pinch of black pepper'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tablespoons chopped fresh chives']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Place Pluots, honey, 4 teaspoons vinegar, 1 tablespoon lemon juice, lemon peel, rosemary, coarse salt, and pinch of pepper in small saucepan. Bring to boil over medium-high heat, stirring. Reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer until fruit has broken down and mixture is thick, stirring occasionally, about 20 minutes. Cool. Adjust seasonings</step>
    <step>2. add chives.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>White Chocolate Truffle and Chocolate Fudge Layer Cake</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['6 ounces bittersweet (not unsweetened) or semisweet chocolate</ingredient>
    <ingredient>chopped'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 tablespoon solid vegetable shortening'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Nonstick vegetable oil spray'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'4 ounces unsweetened chocolate</ingredient>
    <ingredient>chopped'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 3/4 cups all purpose flour'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 cup unsweetened cocoa powder'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 teaspoon baking powder'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3/4 teaspoon baking soda'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 teaspoon salt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 cups sugar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 cup (1 stick) unsalted butter</ingredient>
    <ingredient>room temperature'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 teaspoons vanilla extract'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 large eggs'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 1/2 cups whole milk'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 cups chilled whipping cream'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 cup (1/2 stick) unsalted butter</ingredient>
    <ingredient>cut into pieces'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>"1 pound good-quality white chocolate (such as lindt or Baker's)</ingredient>
    <ingredient>finely chopped"</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 teaspoons vanilla extract'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 teaspoon almond extract'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'4 tablespoons amaretto or other almond liqueur']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Line baking sheet with foil. Stir chocolate and shortening in top of double boiler set over simmering water until melted and smooth. Pour onto prepared baking sheet, tilting pan to spread chocolate mixture to irregular 14x9-inch rectangle. Refrigerate until just firm, about 12 minutes. Spray assorted star-shaped cookie cutters with nonstick spray. Cut out stars. Refrigerate until firm, about 30 minutes. Using small offset spatula, carefully transfer stars 1 at a time to another foil-lined baking sheet. Refrigerate until ready to use. (Can be made 3 days ahead. Cover and keep refrigerated.)</step>
    <step>2. Preheat oven to 350°F. Butter two 9-inch-diameter cake pans with 1 1/2-inch-high sides. Line bottoms with parchment paper</step>
    <step>3. butter parchment. Stir unsweetened chocolate in heavy medium saucepan over low heat until melted and smooth. Cool slightly. Sift flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda, and salt into medium bowl. Using electric mixer, beat sugar and butter in large bowl until well blended. Beat in lukewarm melted unsweetened chocolate and vanilla. Beat in eggs, 1 at a time, blending well after each addition. Mix in cocoa powder mixture in 3 additions, alternating with milk in 2 additions.</step>
    <step>4. Divide batter between prepared pans. Bake cakes until tester inserted into center comes out clean, about 35 minutes. Cool cakes in pans on racks 10 minutes. Run knife around edge of each pan to loosen cakes. Turn cakes out onto racks and cool completely. Peel off parchment.</step>
    <step>5. Bring 1 cup cream and butter to simmer in heavy medium saucepan over medium heat, stirring until butter melts. Remove from heat. Add white chocolate and stir until smooth. Whisk in vanilla. Pour 1 1/2 cups white chocolate filling into small bowl</step>
    <step>6. cover and freeze until cold, about 2 hours.</step>
    <step>7. Let remaining white chocolate mixture in saucepan stand at room temperature until lukewarm, about 20 minutes.</step>
    <step>8. Using electric mixer, beat remaining 2 cups cream and almond extract in large bowl until peaks form. Working in 3 batches, fold in lukewarm white chocolate mixture. Refrigerate whipped cream frosting just until medium peaks hold, folding occasionally, about 3 hours.</step>
    <step>9. Brush 2 tablespoons amaretto over top of each cake layer. Place 1 layer on platter. Spread chilled 1 1/2 cups white chocolate filling over. Top with second cake layer. Spread whipped cream frosting over top and sides of cake. Chill until cold and set, about 1 hour. (Can be made 1 day ahead. Cover and keep refrigerated.)</step>
    <step>10. Arrange chocolate stars decoratively atop cake and serve.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Pop’s Double-Stuffed, Double-Fluffed American Omelet</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['2 maple sausage patties</ingredient>
    <ingredient>crumbled'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'6 slices bacon</ingredient>
    <ingredient>chopped'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 cup sliced mushrooms'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'6 eggs'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 tablespoons half-and-half'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tablespoons unsalted butter'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 cup spinach leaves'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 cup grated cheddar cheese']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. In a 10- or 12-inch skillet, cook the sausage and bacon fully over medium heat. Add the mushrooms and cook until tender. Reserve the mixture in a bowl.</step>
    <step>2. In a blender, whip the eggs and half-and-half until very light, about 90 seconds on high. (A milkshake blender, while not entirely necessary, does offer a little bit more fluff and a bit more fun.)</step>
    <step>3. Give the skillet a wipe and warm it over medium heat. Swirl the butter in the hot pan to coat it completely. Pour the whipped eggs into the pan and cook until fully set around the outer edges, 2 to 3 minutes. Turn the heat to low and top the whole surface of the omelet with the spinach and cheddar. Cook until the spinach is slightly wilted and the cheese begins to melt.</step>
    <step>4. Add the sausage mixture to one side of the eggs and use 2 spatulas to fold the other half over the side with the sausage mixture. Cook until the eggs are set and the cheese is fully melted, another 2 minutes. The outer surface will be lightly browned in places and likely have some spots where cheese has broken the surface and possibly caramelized on the edges. This is considered a good thing, not unlike “burnt ends” in the BBQ world.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Five-Spice Gingersnaps</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['2 cups all-purpose flour'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 3/4 teaspoons Chinese five-spice powder'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 1/2 teaspoons baking soda'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 teaspoon salt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 tablespoons finely chopped crystallized ginger'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 cup sugar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>"1/4 cup lyle's golden Syrup"</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 1/2 sticks (3/4 cup) unsalted butter</ingredient>
    <ingredient>melted and cooled'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 large egg'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'garnish: decorative icing (optional).'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'parchment paper; a 2 1/2-inch round cookie cutter; a piping tip with a 1/4-inch plain round opening (if making cookies into ornaments); pastry bags or several small heavy-duty sealable plastic bags (optional)']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Whisk together flour, five-spice powder, baking soda, and salt in a small bowl.</step>
    <step>2. Pulse ginger with 1/4 cup sugar in a food processor until finely ground.</step>
    <step>3. Add syrup, butter, egg, and remaining 3/4 cup sugar to processor and blend until mixture is thick and creamy, about 3 minutes. Add flour mixture and pulse just until a dough forms. Form dough into a disk and chill, wrapped in plastic wrap, at least 8 hours to allow flavors to develop.</step>
    <step>4. Put oven rack in middle position and preheat oven to 325°F. Line 2 large baking sheets with parchment paper.</step>
    <step>5. Quarter dough. Keeping remaining 3 pieces wrapped in plastic wrap and chilled, roll out 1 piece of dough on a lightly floured sheet of wax paper with a lightly floured rolling pin to 3/4 inch thick. (If dough becomes too soft to roll out, chill on wax paper until firm.) Cut out rounds with cutter and transfer to 1 lined baking sheet, arranging cookies about 2 inches apart.</step>
    <step>6. Bake cookies until slightly puffed and a shade darker, 10 to 12 minutes. Cool 5 minutes on sheet. If desired, make holes with piping tip near edges to hang cookies, then transfer cookies (still on parchment) to a rack to cool completely. (Cookies will flatten slightly as they cool.)</step>
    <step>7. While first batch is baking, roll out and cut another batch, arranging cookies on second lined sheet. Bake in same manner, then gather scraps and chill until dough is firm enough to reroll, 15 to 20 minutes. Make more cookies with scraps (reroll scraps only once) and remaining pieces of dough, cooling sheets and lining them with fresh parchment before using.</step>
    <step>8. If using icing and coloring it, transfer small batches of icing to small bowls, 1 for each color, and tint with food coloring. Spoon each color of icing into a separate pastry bag, pressing out excess air. Twist bag firmly just above icing, then decoratively pipe icing onto cookies. Let icing dry completely (about 1 hour, depending on humidity) before serving or storing cookies.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Roasted Plums With Tahini Dressing</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['2 pounds plums</ingredient>
    <ingredient>halved and pitted'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 teaspoon kosher salt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Freshly cracked black pepper'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 tablespoon fresh thyme and/or oregano leaves</ingredient>
    <ingredient>stripped from about 4 sprigs'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Flaky sea salt for garnish'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Juice of 2 lemons (about 6 tablespoons)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 cup raw tahini (sesame paste)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 teaspoon kosher salt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 ice cube']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Preheat the oven to 400°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Arrange the fruit, cut side up, on the prepared baking sheet. Drizzle with the olive oil and season well with the salt and pepper to taste.</step>
    <step>2. Sprinkle the fruit with all but a pinch of the fresh herbs. Place the baking sheet in the oven and immediately reduce the heat to 250°F. Roast until the fruit is very soft and juicy and starting to caramelize, about 2 hours. (Alternatively, turn off the oven after 1 hour and leave the fruit in the oven overnight. This will produce a more leathery result. Either way is good!)</step>
    <step>3. In a medium bowl, combine 3 tablespoons of the lemon juice, the tahini, 3/4 cup water, salt, and the ice cube. Whisk vigorously until the mixture comes together. It should lighten in color and thicken enough that it holds an edge when the whisk is dragged through it.</step>
    <step>4. Remove the ice cube if any remains unmelted and adjust the seasoning, adding more lemon juice and salt until the sauce is addictive—you will know. Scrape the sauce into a shallow serving dish and hide it from the eaters in your house until ready to serve.</step>
    <step>5. Layer a plate with the roasted fruit, then drizzle with the tahini dressing. Sprinkle with the reserved fresh thyme or oregano and a pinch of flaky sea salt.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>3-Ingredient Grilled and Fresh Tomato Salsa</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['4 medium tomatoes (about 3 ounces)</ingredient>
    <ingredient>divided'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Olive oil (for brushing)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 large white onion</ingredient>
    <ingredient>cut into 1/4" rounds'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 jalapeño</ingredient>
    <ingredient>seeded if desired</ingredient>
    <ingredient>finely chopped'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 1/2 teaspoons kosher salt']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Prepare a grill or grill pan for medium-high heat. Slice 2 tomatoes in half and brush each half with oil. Brush onion with oil. Transfer onions and tomatoes halves to hot grill and cook, turning occasionally, until slightly charred and softened, about 10 minutes. Let cool slightly.</step>
    <step>2. Remove seeds from remaining 2 tomatoes and cut into 1/4" cubes. Transfer to a medium bowl. Add jalapeño and salt and toss to combine. Finely chop cooled onions and tomatoes, then add to raw tomato mixture and toss to combine.</step>
    <step>3. Salsa can be made 1 day ahead. Transfer to an airtight container and chill.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Tagalongs Girl Scout Cookie Mousse Cake</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['2 ounces bittersweet (not unsweetened) or semisweet chocolate</ingredient>
    <ingredient>coarsely chopped'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 (6.5-ounce) box Tagalongs/Peanut Butter Patties girl Scout cookies'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 1/2 cups peanut butter chips (about 9 ounces)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 1/2 cups plus 2 tablespoons heavy cream'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 tablespoons creamy peanut butter (not natural</ingredient>
    <ingredient>old-fashioned</ingredient>
    <ingredient>or freshly ground)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 1/2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 tablespoons sugar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Equipment: 1 (9- by 5-inch) loaf pan; plastic wrap; stand mixer fitted with the whisk attachment']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Line a 9- by 5-inch loaf pan with plastic wrap, making sure the plastic is tucked into the corners and leaving at least a 2-inch overhang on all sides.</step>
    <step>2. In a dry metal bowl set over a pan of barely simmering water, melt the chocolate, stirring until smooth. Let cool slightly.</step>
    <step>3. Spread a small amount of melted chocolate on the rounded side of 9 cookies and place 3 of them, chocolate side down, on the bottom of the pan, in a row. Place another 3 cookies against each long side of the pan with the chocolate-coated sides facing the pan. Place the pan in the freezer.</step>
    <step>4. In a small saucepan over low heat, combine the peanut butter chips with 1 cup plus 2 tablespoons of the heavy cream. Warm, stirring frequently, until the peanut butter chips are just melted. Remove from the heat and continue to stir until the mixture is smooth. Add the peanut butter and the vanilla and stir until incorporated.</step>
    <step>5. In a stand mixer fitted with the whisk attachment, combine the remaining 1 1/2 cups heavy cream with the sugar and beat until the cream is very thick but not yet holding peaks. Add the whipped cream to the peanut butter mixture in 3 additions and fold in just until the mousse is streak-free.</step>
    <step>6. Carefully spoon about 3/4 of the mousse into the prepared pan, being careful not to move the cookies. Insert the remaining cookies into the mousse, arranging them in a row down the center of the loaf pan. Spread the remaining mousse over the wafers and carefully smooth the top. Press plastic wrap directly on the surface of the mousse then wrap the entire pan in a double layer of plastic wrap and chill until firm, at least 1 hour or overnight. DO AHEAD: The mousse cake can be made ahead, wrapped in a double layer of plastic wrap, and chilled for up to 3 days.</step>
    <step>7. To serve, take the mousse cake out of the refrigerator and remove the double layer of plastic wrap, along with the plastic wrap pressed on the surface of the mousse. Using the overhanging plastic wrap that lines the pan, carefully lift and loosen the cake from the pan without removing it. Place a large plate or platter on top of the pan then invert the cake and the plate. Remove the pan and the plastic wrap and serve immediately.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Chowders</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['4 ounces (2/3 cup) diced blanched salt pork or bacon'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 Tbs butter'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 cups (1 pound) sliced onions'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 imported bay leaf'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3/4 cup crumbled "common" or pilot crackers</ingredient>
    <ingredient>or 1 pressed-down cup fresh white bread crumbs'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'6 cups liquid (milk</ingredient>
    <ingredient>chicken stock</ingredient>
    <ingredient>fish stock</ingredient>
    <ingredient>clam juices</ingredient>
    <ingredient>or a combination)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 1/2 cups (1 pound) peeled and sliced or diced boiling potatoes'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Salt and freshly ground white pepper']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Sauté the pork or bacon bits slowly with the butter in a large saucepan for 5 minutes, or until pieces begin to brown. Stir in the onions and bay leaf</step>
    <step>2. cover, and cook slowly 8 to 10 minutes, until the onions are tender. Drain off fat and blend crackers or bread crumbs into onions. Pour in the liquid</step>
    <step>3. add the potatoes and simmer, loosely covered, for 20 minutes or so, until the potatoes are tender. Season to taste with salt and white pepper, and the soup base is ready.</step>
    <step>4. For about 2 1/2 quarts, serving 6 to</step>
    <step>5. Scrub and soak 24 medium-size hard-shell clams. Steam them for 3 to 4 minutes in a large tightly covered saucepan with 1 cup water, until most have opened. Remove the opened clams</step>
    <step>6. cover, and steam the rest another minute or so. Discard any unopened clams. Pluck meat from the shells, then decant steaming-liquid very carefully, so all sand remains in the saucepan</step>
    <step>7. include the clam-steaming liquid as part of the chowder base. Meanwhile, mince the clam meats in a food processor or chop by hand. Fold them into the finished chowder base. Just before serving, heat to below the simmer--so the clams won't overcook and toughen. Fold in a little heavy cream or sour cream if you wish</step>
    <step>8. thin with milk if necessary, correct seasoning, and serve.</step>
    <step>9. To prepare clams: Scrub one at a time under running water, discarding any that are cracked, damaged, or not tightly closed. Soak 30 minutes in a basin of salted water (1/3 cup salt per 4 quarts water). Lift out, and if more than a few grains of sand remain in the basin, repeat. Refrigerate, covered by a damp towel. It's wise to use them within a day or two.</step>
    <step>10. Prepare the chowder base using fish stock, and/or light chicken stock, and milk. Cut into 2-inch chunks 2 to 2 1/2 pounds of skinless, boneless lean fish, such as cod, haddock, halibut, monkfish, or sea bass, all one kind or a mixture. Add to the finished chowder base and simmer 2 to 3 minutes, just until fish is opaque and springy. Correct seasoning, and top each serving, if you wish, with a spoonful of sour cream.</step>
    <step>11. Prepare the chowder base using 6 cups of light chicken stock and milk. Stir 3 cups or so of grated fresh corn into the finished base, adding, if you wish, 2 green and/or red peppers chopped fine and sautéed briefly in butter. Bring to the simmer for 2 to 3 minutes</step>
    <step>12. correct seasoning, and top each serving, if you wish, with a spoonful of sour cream.</step>
    <step>13. Prepare the chowder base using 6 cups of light chicken stock and milk. Stir 3 cups or so of grated fresh corn into the finished base, adding, if you wish, 2 green and/or red peppers chopped fine and sautéed briefly in butter. Bring to the simmer for 2 to 3 minutes</step>
    <step>14. correct seasoning, and top each serving, if you wish, with a spoonful of sour cream.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Amaretto Zabaglione</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['6 large egg yolks'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/3 cup amaretto or other almond liqueur'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>"3 tablespoons baker's sugar (superfine sugar) or regular sugar"</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 cup whipping cream']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Whisk egg yolks, amaretto, and sugar in medium metal bowl to blend. Set bowl over saucepan of simmering water. Whisk mixture constantly and vigorously until thickened and instant-read thermometer inserted into mixture registers 140°F for 3 minutes, about 5 minutes total. Remove mixture from over water. Add cream and whisk until incorporated. Serve warm or chilled.</step>
    <step>2. (If serving chilled, zabaglione can be prepared 1 day ahead and refrigerated. Rewhisk before serving.)</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Woodman Cheese and Crackers</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['1 1/2 cups (13 oz / 363 g) whole milk'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 cup (4.1 oz / 116 g) heavy cream'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 teaspoon Maldon sea salt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 1/2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 cup (2.5 oz / 70 g) whole wheat pastry flour'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 cup (2.1 oz / 60 g) rye flour'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 tablespoon sugar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 teaspoon Maldon sea salt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 teaspoon baking powder'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 teaspoon caraway seeds'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'4 tablespoons (2 oz / 56 g) cold unsalted butter</ingredient>
    <ingredient>cut into small chunks'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 cup (2.1 oz / 60 g) whole-milk plain yogurt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Colorful edible flower petals</ingredient>
    <ingredient>for garnish'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Maldon sea salt</ingredient>
    <ingredient>for garnish']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. To make the ricotta cheese, line a colander with a double layer of cheesecloth and set the colander over a bowl.</step>
    <step>2. Combine the milk, cream, and salt in a small saucepan and cook over medium-low heat, stirring often to prevent scorching, until the mixture registers 190°F on a digital thermometer.</step>
    <step>3. Remove the pan from the heat and gently stir in the lemon juice. Let stand for 5 minutes, and then pour the curds and whey through the cheesecloth-lined colander. Let drain at room temperature until the cheese is thick and spreadable, about 1 hour.</step>
    <step>4. Transfer the cheese to a container, cover tightly, and refrigerate.</step>
    <step>5. Combine the whole wheat flour, rye flour, sugar, salt, baking powder, and caraway seeds in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment. Mix briefly on low speed to blend. Add the butter and mix on low speed until the mixture resembles coarse meal, 1 to 2 minutes. Add the yogurt and continue mixing just until the dough comes together into a ball, 10 to 20 seconds.</step>
    <step>6. Turn out the dough onto a large sheet of parchment paper and press it into a flat, even rectangle measuring about 5 by 6 inches. Lay a second sheet of parchment paper on top and roll out the dough to an even 1/8-inch thickness. Remove the top sheet of parchment and, using a chef's knife, cut the dough into rough 2 by 4-inch rectangles. The dough will be sticky, so don't try to remove the rectangles until after chilling. Slide the parchment with the dough onto a baking sheet and refrigerate until the dough is firm, at least 30 minutes or up to 1 week.</step>
    <step>7. To make the crackers, position racks in upper and lower thirds of the oven. Preheat the oven to 400°F and line two baking sheets with parchment paper.</step>
    <step>8. Using a small spatula, carefully remove the crackers and place them on the prepared baking sheets, spacing them 1 inch apart.</step>
    <step>9. Bake, rotating the baking sheets midway through baking, until the crackers are golden brown and crisp, 10 to 12 minutes. Let cool for 10 minutes on the baking sheets, and then use a spatula to transfer the crackers to a wire rack to finish cooling.</step>
